  1. Worked as advertised.

  3. So far, one star is all I am can give.I followed the directions exactly, I am heading into day five and have seen no difference- no peeling ,sloughing,NOTHING!   4. My feet are much softer after using this product but mine didn't peel off in big pieces like some of the pics that others posted did. My feet peeled in small pieces for about 2 weeks. I did soak my feet before using the product and every day after for 2 weeks. Since mine didn't peel off in big pieces I used my pumice stone to help get off the dead skin. Overall, the product did help my feet but didn't give me the results I had imagined after reading others reviews.
  5. Thought nothing was going to happen, on day 6 feet started to peel, WOW! what a difference. I won't be ashamed to show my feet in summer shoes<br />All that ugliness is gone. Terrific product.
  6. I have now purchased this product twice and I am happy with the end result. You should be warned however, that the sloughing off of you skin is not a pretty process (which in part is why you would by this product). No great surprise, I know, but it is a bit of a drawn-out process since it occurs over several days (possibly up to a week). About three days after you apply the product, I would recommend taking a wash cloth towards the end of your shower and rubbing your feet to help speed up the process and to contain the skin in the tub. It really does peel off in rather large pieces so be prepared! It costs less than a pedicure however, and my feet really are as smooth as they have ever been as an adult. The key is to just keep with moisturizing your feet to prolong the softness (which I didn't do the first time and is the reason I had to buy the product again).
  7. Worked great! The key is to soak your feet first. If you do that, it will work.
  8. A bit of exfoliation, but not like I had hoped. A good exfoliating pedicure would have been much more pleasant and as effective. As usual, I have to remind myself to just continue to use a pumice stone, exfoliating foot scrub and lotion with AHA every night.   31. I used this product about 4 weeks ago. I take very good care of my feet: have regular pedicures and exfoliate my feet in the shower. I used the plastic boots as recommended, following a 30-45 minute soak in hot water and let my feet sit in the clear gel solution the recommended time. The smell is citrusy and not unpleasant. Your feet will begin to peel a few days later. It is quite shocking, so don't be surprised. I wore socks the whole time they were &#34;shedding&#34;, even to bed, and scrubbed my feet in each shower to assist the process. All the old callused winter skin sloughed off and my feet look great and ready to face the season of sandals. I also made my boyfriend use it and his feet look great, too! Recommended. I plan to use Baby Feet every winter now.
  32. This did a tremendous job on my feet. I soaked my feet first, as recommended, then applied the booties with the gel inside. I thought I was going to be someone who reported it &#34;didn't work&#34; but on day 7, my feet started to peel. While I didn't get sheets of skin peeling off as some users report, I definitely got baby soft feet out of it. My advice: wear socks, especially to bed, until the process is complete.

  41. 6/22/13 (am)-I was so inspired by that other dude's multi-day review that i just had to make my own! So here it is. Today is the morning after i first put the booties on. How it feels & looks today, i'll get to later, but let me reiterate what everyone else is saying: it's probably best to follow the tips on here rather than on the box. My feet, prior to this morning, looked like a cross between an alligator, bluegill, and the Grand Canyon. They were leathery in spots, had flakey scaley crap falling off, and would get dry cracks in them that you could lose a small child in. I'm *kind of* hoping this product will change that, and so far so good! So the tips on here (two hour soak instead of one, etc.) are right on for heavy duty gator feet like mine.<br /><br />That being said, last night i put the booties on. I want to say something other than booties, but my manlihood was severely damaged enough last night by the wifey wanting to take a picture of me in my temporary footware, so saying booties won't make things any worse. I keep telling myself, no more socks to bed! Wife likes smooth feet! She won't wake up screaming about a sandpaper monster if my toes brush against her at night under the covers! So that makes me feel better. But wearing bootes for 2 hours, walking like i had to poo (it's hard to walk on gel), and the wife giggling at me the whole time (half at the booties, half at the fact that i was gonna have smooth feet) was quite the experience.<br /><br />Today is day one...so far, i didn't expect to see any results, but it appears my gators are starting to shed already. Can gators shed? Well, the skin is falling off or anything, but it already looks like...it's hard to explain it. It's almost like when you were in grade school, and you were making crafts. You got some glue on your skin, and it dried. Right before you peeled it off, it kind of looks like that. Like i'm about ready to molt.<br /><br />I really hope this product works as well as i've heard, because i'm ready to stop wearing sock to bed on these hot stinking summer nights! And the wife says she can't wait to help me peel the skin off my feet. All the dudes out there that are using this-are your wives as twisted as mine? The wierd thing is, the twisteder she gets the hotter she gets.<br /><br />I'll be back for day 2 tomorrow!<br />6-22-13 (pm) Okay so it's still inside day one, and the tops of my feet are already molting...the tops were the smooth parts! Eh, oh well, that hopefully means the bottoms of will start peeling tonight when the wife gets home from work. We can sit back, have some wine, eat some ice cream, watch some DVR'ed movies, and peel skin like the freaks we are!<br /><br />another update: cue the itchy peely toes...did anyone else have this stiff work this fast? the bottom and sides of my feel are starting to look like the final stages of a monarch butterfly metamorphosis!<br /><br />6-23-13<br />It's nearing the end of day two, and there are a couple of spots in the house that look like a 20 foot anaconda molted and slithered off into the Amazon (heehee). The tops and toes are peeling like crazy, and the bottoms are starting up. The only bad thing (besides the trail of dead skin...how am i supposed to play hide and seek with my kids now???) is the bottoms of my feet are a little uncomfortable, like, well, the skin is stretching and about to peel off. I feel sorry for whoever has to vacuum this crap up lol<br /><br />6-24-13<br />Bazinga! Had my first huge piece of skin come off the bottom! And only 2 days after the start, not bad! Most of the area is still to sensitive to pull the skin off. I thought i had a piece of fuzz hanging off my toe when i got home from work, but it was all the skin off my toe! The calluses are coming off my big toes, which gosh, i'm sure you wall wanted to know. But if you have dino feet like me and that other reviewer, you'll sympathize! This big suckers eat their way thru the covers on the bed at night like afreakin cracked out mole through wet sand!<br /><br />6-29-13<br />Let me summarize the last 4 or 5 days...SKIN EVERYWHERRRRE! we've had to vacuum a couple times, simply because it wouldn't stop coming off hahaha...i slept without socks for the first time last night, and by golly i'll probably do it again tonite. my toes seem to be able to regenerate the calluses on the sides of them, so if you have that problem like me, it'll take some sanding and major lotioning to keep up the smoothynesses that the babyfoot stuff did for me. To sum it up, the 5 stars i gave it the first day still hold! i have no idea how long my feet'll stay smooth, but i'll enjoy my day or two of no socks to bed!freakin cracked out mole through wet sand!<br /><br />6-29-13<br />Let me summarize the last 4 or 5 days...SKIN EVERYWHERRRRE! we've had to vacuum a couple times, simply because it wouldn't stop coming off hahaha...i slept without socks for the first time last night, and by golly i'll probably do it again tonite. my toes seem to be able to regenerate the calluses on the sides of them, so if you have that problem like me, it'll take some sanding and major lotioning to keep up the smoothynesses that the babyfoot stuff did for me.   42. A &#34;must do&#34; before flip flop season
  43. Full results yet to be determined, which is why I currently give the product 3 stars. I'll update as I proceed.<br /><br />Day 1: Took a 30 minute hot bath with sea salt soak in order to prepare my feet. I opened the package and cut open the bootie packets which were exactly as pictured. There is a lavender smell but also something sharper and a bit stringent, which is not surprising. Overall not a bad smell. It was fairly unpleasant sliding my feet into cold jelly, and some liquid did ooze out the top, so I recommend having an old towel under your feet for the duration. The tape that came with the booties to close them up around your ankles was completely useless, so I just slid on some old fuzzy socks and that held them on well enough. Sat for an hour and then because the baby was sleeping, carefully made my way upstairs - NOT advised. Very hard to walk. I removed the booties and rinsed my feet very well in the tub - did not re-soak as I did not have time. No lotion. About four hours later my feet felt a bit puffy and kind of burned - as if I'd been walking on hot sand all day. The skin also felt a bit itchy. There was no redness and this feeling subsided by the time I went to bed.<br /><br />Day 2: Skin might look a little shiny, otherwise no change. Stopped up the shower drain to soak feet while I showered.<br /><br />Day 3: Now we're talking...soaked my feet for 15 minutes after work and had large areas of shedding!<br /><br />Day 4-5: Shedding continued in smaller amounts. Not quite the huge sheets that previous reviews had led me to believe, but perhaps because I was not soaking (except day 3), just stopping up the shower drain.<br /><br />Days 6-8: This was the annoying part. Itchy flaky skin on tops and sides of my feet, more irritating than anything else. It was like a constant shower of tiny flakes any time I moved my feet, and was driving me crazy. Finally took a pumice stone to it to end it because I was fed up. At this point I also put lotion on the tops and sides of my feet.<br /><br />Verdict: Eh. It was fun, interesting to see the process, but I don't feel like the real problem areas got any more result than a particularly thorough pedicure would have. I still have thick areas on the balls of my feet and heels. Maybe if I try again and am aggressive with daily soaking but for now I'll stick with pedicures. It was a cool experiment but not the rave reviews I was expecting.<br /><br />To be continued.dict: Eh. It was fun, interesting to see the process, but I don't feel like the real problem areas got any more result than a particularly thorough pedicure would have. I still have thick areas on the balls of my feet and heels. Maybe if I try again and am aggressive with daily soaking but for now I'll stick with pedicures. It was a cool experiment but not the rave reviews I was expecting. To be continued.
  44. This product is the only one of it's kind that actually completely peels off layers of dead skin. It's not a pretty process but if you can stand to wear the plastic booties for an hour and then socks for the next week afterwards they're great. The skin takes a couple days to start peeling and then the skin on your entire feet including the tops will shed off. I've used these twice and it takes about a week for the skin to completely come off with me helping peel off some of the skin. You have to wear socks for a week during the process so it's not good to do it in the summer or if you're planning on wearing sandals.

  51. Love baby foot exfoliation, in a matter of days my feet went from very dry, cracked heels to smooth and soft. The peeling last about 3 days but it does not hurt in the least. Highly recommend this product.
  52. As I have grown older, so have my feet. Where they used to be soft and smooth, they developed calluses and cracked heels. Weekly soaks with Johnson Foot Soap followed by a session with a pumice stone help, but I wanted a much quicker solution to get back to pretty feet.<br /><br />I found Baby Foot at Amazon's website, and after reading other customers' positive reviews, decided to give it a try.<br /><br />The instructions state to remove nail polish from your toenails prior to use and to clean your feet thoroughly. After removing my nail polish, I soaked my feet in a Johnson's Foot Soak for a half hour, occasionally brushing them with a bath brush. Then I dried my feet thoroughly before slipping on the Baby Foot booties.<br /><br />The booties are completely sealed when they arrive, and you simply cut the top off. They are full of a gel that is a little cool, but not uncomfortably so. You wear these booties for two hours, taking care not to `spread' the gel. I took that to mean they don't want you to walk much, and I tried to sit still, but that is sometimes easier said than done. I did minimize my movements and stayed seated as long as possible, but I will confess to getting up probably three times while wearing the booties.<br /><br />When the two hours is up, you are advised to immediately wash your feet well, then clean the tub or sink that you washed your feet in. The first thing I noticed after washing and drying my feet is that the biggest callouses (which were on my big toes), were nearly completely gone. Any raised skin was gone. There were still callouses and cracked heels, but there was an immediate improvement.<br /><br />The instructions say that the dead skin should start to peel off your feet in approximately two days and the complete process may take seven days. I soaked my feet in the booties on a Saturday night and didn't really have much dead skin peeling until Wednesday. Once it started, though, it really started. The peeling continued until the second Sunday (8 days after I performed the treatment.)<br /><br />The final result is really amazing. While I still have a few small areas that could use attention, my feet are so much nicer now. The calluses on my big toes are gone, and I have just a little bit of the cracked heels left, but it was mostly taken care of with one treatment. My feet were in such bad shape by the time I did this, I'm not surprised that I might need a second treatment.<br /><br />I highly recommend this product to anyone who wants to easily melt away calluses and cracked heels from their feet.e second Sunday (8 days after I performed the treatment.)<br /><br />The final result is really amazing. While I still have a few small areas that could use attention, my feet are so much nicer now. The calluses on my big toes are gone, and I have just a little bit of the cracked heels left, but it was mostly taken care of with one treatment. My feet were in such bad shape by the time I did this, I'm not surprised that I might need a second treatment.<br /><br />I highly recommend this product to anyone who wants to easily melt away calluses and cracked heels from their feet.

  85. A lifetime of going barefoot inside and an aversion to socks with most shoes plus two years of desert living in sandals and my feet were finally ready for walking on hot coals! Cue Baby Foot praise online and a last ditch effort to have soft feet again since being a toddler. Baby Foot has worked well for me! As other reviewers have mentioned... 1. Soak feet for at least 30 minutes before using Baby Foot to soften the skin and help the feet absorb the gel better. 2. Leave Baby Foot on for 1.5 to 2 hours as long as your feet are not feeling irritated by the gel. 3. Rinse gel off well. 4. Soak feet daily or every other day in warm water mixed with plain old Listerine (yellow kind) and vinegar to soften the dead skin so it will slough off more easily. 5. You can pick off the dead skin. Just be careful and be patient. 6. Wear socks during peeling process to keep the dead skin flakes contained. Good luck with your baby foot journey. Softer feet can be yours again, friend. You can use the 2nd pack two weeks later if you still have some tough calluses you want completely gone.

Those areas, this foot mask didnt even put a dent in it. Never peeled on the super hard callused areas. Will never waste $$ on this again.

  140. I read about Baby Foot and had to give it a try. I got best results by wearing the socks for a bit longer than instructed, and by soaking my feet before using and every day after until they stopped peeling.

I had so hoped this product would work for me. I even soaked them on day 4 as one reviewer suggested. I am contemplating purchasing another and trying it again, but I don't know if I should waste $20. Maybe I just have really tough feet, although they are dry they don't have deep cracks. I would rate my feet as standard with dry skin, so this product should of worked wonders right? The product itself is simple to use and there is no odor. I recommend watching a show or reading while you are doing the treatment, because they are too slippery to walk in. Another reviewer gave a great tip of slipping on your uggs or something similar and that would probably work. However it does say the product could stain clothes, rugs, or furniture, so I would be careful :)

I would not put the footsies on the top of the feet next time, because you also peel there up to your ankles, if you allow the gel like substance to touch your upper part of your feet.   191. The directions in the box are not detailed and I found good instructions on line. 1) soak feet for 15 min in plain water before using Baby Foot; 2) use Baby Foot exactly as directed; 3) Wash feet with soap and water, rinse, then soak feet again in plain water for 15 min. 4) If skin sloughing does not begin after 2-4 days, soak feet for 30 min in plain water. When feet are blotted dry you should see sloughing and peeling. More sloughing and peeling will occur if you soak another 30 min. 5) Thereafter for the next two weeks, continue to soak feet in plain water for 30 min to an hour ever day or every other day to encourage more peeling and sloughing.

  227. My feet were never that bad, mainly just some dry spots on the heels and on the ball of my foot near my pinkie toe. I get pedicures regularly but I my feet are ticklish so I've always wondered if they were really getting everything off my feet that they could, or just rushing through the pumice part worried I'd jerk and kick them. So, I bought Baby Foot thinking I could get all the dead skin off and start new. I read all the reviews on here first.<br />The Beginning: I washed my feet, then soaked them for 30 minutes. I put on the booties and socks on top and then watched some television. I ended up leaving it on for close to 90 minutes, I got caught up in a show. Rinsed my feet really well, dried them and went about my afternoon. It immediately felt like there was liquid trapped in the arches of my feet when I would walk. Weird, but not unbearable. That night I couldn't sleep. My feet were so dry they felt like they were going to crack in half. I soaked them for 10 minutes and was finally able to go to bed. Day 2-14: My feet became insanely dry, even with soaking for 20+ minutes every night. Every crease in my foot was bright white. The balls of my feet turned into sandpaper. I felt my feet getting stuck to socks. It was terrible. Day 15: no sign of peeling and I couldn't take my dry, scratchy feet anymore. I spent nearly 30 minutes on each foot with a pumice stone and even a callous shaver in some parts. I slathered them in lotion and put on socks. It made no difference. Day 16-19: more work with the pumice stone and more soaking in hot water. I bought Palmer's cocoa butter (the wax like stuff, not the lotion) and began spreading a 1/4 inch thick smear of it all over my feet, wrapping them in plastic wrap, putting on socks and going to bed. Day 20: I was running errands for work and felt like something was stuck under my big toe. Nope. Nearly a week after they should have started to peel, the peeling began. More lotion and more soaking, but the skin didn't really come off too much. Day 23-25: Finally some noticeable peeling, but we were spending the weekend away and walking a bunch. All of the new, soft skin was now going to become hard from miles of walk. Just great. Day 28: The tops of my feet started to peel and I looked diseased. Fun times. Day 30: My toes started to peel. More looking diseased. Day 32: In desperate need of a pedicure, I sucked up my embarrassment and went. My pedicure lady yelled at me telling me if I wanted softer feet I should have come to her and we could have tried different lotions. She told me I better never use this on my feet again. She also peeled another layer off all of my toes. Day 40: There are still spots that are peeling, mainly on the sides of my feet where the skin is thin to begin with and just doesn't want to come off. It took my feet so long to peel that by the time all of the bottoms of my feet had peeled, there was a mix of new soft skin and new skin that had already begun to get dry, despite lotion.<br /><br />So I guess it worked, but to have my feet still peeling after almost 5 weeks and the fact that they barely stayed soft? It's just not worth it. I'll stick with the cocoa butter/plastic wrap routine on top of my regular pedicures instead.ff too much. Day 23-25: Finally some noticeable peeling, but we were spending the weekend away and walking a bunch. All of the new, soft skin was now going to become hard from miles of walk. Just great. Day 28: The tops of my feet started to peel and I looked diseased. Fun times. Day 30: My toes started to peel. More looking diseased. Day 32: In desperate need of a pedicure, I sucked up my embarrassment and went. My pedicure lady yelled at me telling me if I wanted softer feet I should have come to her and we could have tried different lotions. She told me I better never use this on my feet again. She also peeled another layer off all of my toes. Day 40: There are still spots that are peeling, mainly on the sides of my feet where the skin is thin to begin with and just doesn't want to come off. It took my feet so long to peel that by the time all of the bottoms of my feet had peeled, there was a mix of new soft skin and new skin that had already begun to get dry, despite lotion. So I guess it worked, but to have my feet still peeling after almost 5 weeks and the fact that they barely stayed soft? It's just not worth it. I'll stick with the cocoa butter/plastic wrap routine on top of my regular pedicures instead.

  247. I would highly recommend this product. The product was exactly as advertised. I soaked my feet for 30 minutes in plain water prior to using the product. I wore the product for an hour as suggested in the directions. I suggest using the product near to where you will be washing your feet. The directions say that you should not try to walk with the product on due to slipping and this is definitely true. It was an adventure to make it up my stairs to rinse the product off. After rinsing the product off I did feel a very mild itching sensation on my feet but it did not last long. After 2 days the very top of my feet started to slightly peel. It took another few days before the rest of my feet began to shed. I soaked my feet for about 15 minutes every other day and would lightly rub them while in the water to help get the peeling skin off. This worked great. I do not suggest picking any of the dead skin off as this can expose new skin that is not ready. It has now been a week and four days and my feet are pretty much done. I have very mild peeling on the inside of my arch but it is close to none. I was very impressed with how well it worked on my heels. Two weeks prior to this product I had been consistently trying to get rid of my &#34;winter feet&#34; with no success. When my heels began to peel it had looked like they were still dry but give it time and they will look great. I will definitely be using this product again.

I have very thick skin on my feet. VERY thick. I believe it comes from genetics because my dads feet are the same way. Every two weeks I was getting my feet done.and it seemed like every two weeks the same amount of skin came off my feet. I chalked it up as I might as well just deal with it, it's going to be like this for the rest of my life. I just got tired of the skin piling up after a while. I started researching some helpful things for this dead skin... And baby foot was one of them. I decided to take a chance and try out out...I had nothing to lose. I placed my feet into the booties for 2 hours instead of 1 like it said on the package, and I put socks on over the booties. It's been about a week and I've been taking baths every night to get a good soak. This product really works! The skin practically wipes off day by day. I'll update you on any changes that happen. Thanks baby foot!
  318. Amazing. I'm almost excited to get a pedicure now! No sanding/scraping required!
  319. This product really work.
  320. What a great product! Did everything it claimed it would do. Love it!
  321. This is my third time buying these bad boys and I would repurchase again and again. Late winter is the best time to use these as your feet are still covered and no one will question your possible leprosy when your skin is shedding everywhere. Another reviewer has the ultimate key to making these work best: soak your feet prior to applying, leave on for around 1 1/2-2 hours, soak your feet after removing, and continue soaking your feet for 30 minutes to 1 hour daily after the first 2-3 days. Then brace yourself for the sick pleasure of watching your skin peel off in sheets. Also, I highly recommend wearing socks to bed every night. There will be flakes/pieces of skin everywhere, so it's best to try and contain them as much as possible.

An hour later I take off the bags and rinse my feet as directed. About 3-4 days later, usually while I'm showering I notice my foot starting to peel. Then shortly there after big pieces just fall off. Kind of gross, but better in the trash than on my foot. AND it only affects the dead skin on the bottom and sides of toes. The top of my foot has never peeled.

This is a classic case of bate and switch. They lead you to believe you are getting a real product and then send you a cheap Chinese knock off. The real Baby Foot works great, but if you buy it here, you won't get the real product (only a very bad fake)!

  343. For years I had crusty soles that would routinely shred wool tights. I would pay $60 every month or two for a pedicure that supposedly treated calloused feet. Although improved, they were never baby smooth, and turned rough again within a week. Based on the reviews on Amazon and elsewhere, I decided to give Baby Foot a try. It's basically an acid peel for the feet, and since I routinely use an acid peel for the face with great results, I thought I'd give it a go. I was dubious at first - it took a little over a week for the peeling to start - but once it did, my baby feet slowly and painlessly began to emerge. It's been three months of happy feet, and I am starting to feel a few rough patches. I will be treating with Baby Foot again. I routinely recommend this product to friends. Just amazing. Gently, no aroma, a good excuse for putting your feet up for two hours and watching a movie!

I finally got brave enough, so, after reading the directions several times - and Following Them - I sat down with a good book. Then I needed a drink of water. As other reviewers have said, take them off near the tub so you don't track the goop all over the house. I ended up leaving them on for 2 hours because it was a really good book and I lost track of time.<br /><br />On day 3 I was beginning to believe this was a scam. I still had Hobbit feet only they were dry and itchy. I went back through the directions and reviews to find clues. I had figured the soaking my feet got in the shower would he good enough. It's not. Give it a couple days and do a serious foot soak for at least 30 minutes. I did that today, again with a good book, and still didn't see anything. At least not until my feet dried. I was walking barefoot around the house about an hour later when I took a step and felt cold on the bottom of my foot. A HUGE piece of skin had come off and stuck to the floor behind me. YUCK! I sat down to inspect the bottoms of my feet and skin was coming loose all over! Gentle rubbing, not peeling or pulling, has gotten the worst of it off and they're still peeling. By the looks of it, this process is going to need a couple more days and at least one more good soak.   413. I didn't have awful feet, but despite frequent pedicures, my heels always looked dry & I had lots of thick skin around the toenails. I soaked in warm water for a good while, then put on the booties, with a pair of socks over to hold them in place. Find yourself a good spot when you do this, because you won't be walking around for an hour. I went to my desk with a glass of ice water and my computer, slid on the booties, and the hour was up before I knew it. I toddled to the bathroom, washed the gel off thoroughly. Absolutely nothing happened for about 5 days, then suddenly, pouf, the dead skin started peeling off, even on the toes. The top of the feet, where there wasn't much of a problem, came last, kind of just flaky. I felt nothing this whole time; there was no redness,no irritation at all. It was like magic. I put off having a pedicure for a month, never said a word about what I'd done. My regular lady said my feet were really in nice shape, & of course she took all the credit for it because of her great pedicures. I just smiled sweetly & said nothing.

The skin started to peel four days later and continued for a few days after. I was worried that the fresh skin underneath would feel raw and sensitive, but the peeling actually revealed some very healthy, rejuvenated skin. My heels started to peel first, then the balls of my feet--the driest parts. It was oddly satisfying to pull off giant pieces of dead skin. The skin around the toes and the tops and sides of my feet were more flaky and I couldn't really pull them off as easily because they're not flat surfaces. You just kind of have to rub it off in the shower or let it fall off on the floor.<br /><br />So overall, I'm really impressed with the product. My feet are so soft!

  434. First off, I would like to confess that I am embarrassed of my feet. When I get pedicures with my friends, I always pre-prep my feet hoping for them to look at least a little less embarrassing when I take my shoes off at the salon. I am always the one who needs the cheese grater for my heels, and I always tip extra because I know I'm THAT lady. So when I read the reviews of this product, I thought &#34;Yeah, right.&#34;<br /><br />When I got the package, I opened it up and there were two thin plastic booties sealed at the top. I have big feet (11), and I was so happy that the booties were quite large. As per the instructions, I washed and dried my feet. I cut the top off one of the booties and put them on my foot, one at a time. The booties were more than ample for my long feet. I put a pair of non-skid socks over the top, so I could feel more secure if I needed to walk around during the hour.<br /><br />I sat and waited the hour. During that time, I didn't feel anything except maybe a little tingling. It's possible that was just in my head, though, since I had read other people who said they felt that.<br /><br />I took off the booties and washed my feet, hoping that maybe something magical had happened and the booties would come off to reveal the beautiful soft feet I've always wanted. Nope. Nothing. So I waited...one day...two days...four days, nothing. I thought I got duped.<br /><br />I woke up on the 5th day, and lo and behold my feet were shedding like mad. All of the old, dry skin was painlessly flaking away and under it was new, healthy, smooth skin. It's been about 3 days and they're still shedding a little on my toes. Hooray! I wasn't duped.<br /><br />However, it wasn't the perfect cure all I had hoped for. The heals and balls of my feet didn't seem to shed as much as everywhere else.   443. I am a 55 year old woman who was a summertime, outdoor life guard all through my high school and college years. Needless to say, I developed tough feet from walking on hot concrete pool decks for years.<br /><br />Five years ago, my feet suddenly went from tough to thick callused, cracked and bleeding. It was both painful and ugly. I went to dermatologists who prescribed creams and ointment. I went to podiatrists who shaved off the outer layers of the calluses. I had weekly pedicures. But nothing seemed to work.<br /><br />Two months ago, I saw the Baby Feet product mentioned in several magazines. I went online and did a little more research and decided to give it a try. Why not? I had tried everything else. I ordered 2 sets.<br /><br />The first time I used Baby Feet, I followed the directions perfectly. 10 days later I had very minimal peeling. I was kind of disappointed, so I went back and read other users' comments. Several people suggested soaking your feet in warm water prior to using the product (which I did not do originally). Most importantly, one user suggested keeping the booties on for 2 hours instead of the 1 hour listed in the directions. Knowing that I had tough, tough feet with very thick calluses, I decided to try the 2 hours and see what happens. I also planned on soaking my feet nightly in warm water to help speed things along.<br /><br />I SOOO wished I had taken pictures...but after only 2 days, the calluses on the ball of my feet and the calluses on my heels were just hanging. It was amazing. The product seemed to just attack the areas on my feet with the thickest and hardest calluses. The rest of the foot did peel, but not to the extent of my problem areas. I was thrilled and my husband was even impressed.<br /><br />Knowing that I had years of damage to undo, I have continued to use the product about once a month. Each time, I continue to get results, but to a lesser degree mainly because the calluses are so minimal. My shoes are even fitting differently!<br /><br />I can not recommend this product enough!! I wish I had found it years ago.are even fitting differently!<br /><br />I can not recommend this product enough!! I wish I had found it years ago.

  460. I wish I took before and after pictures. My heels have always been extremely dry, flaky, cracked and at times, painful. Nothing worked anywhere near as well as Baby Foot.<br /><br />Be aware that you need to be essentially immobile for two hours while you have the booties on. They are not designed to be walked-in and the gel is super slippery so even if you're careful you still will probably fall down.<br /><br />There's no odor and I didn't experience any kind of tingling (although other reviewers have).<br /><br />After two hours with my feet up (which was a mini vacation in and of itself) I washed the gel off in the shower and put on some cotton socks and went to bed. The dry stuff is almost completely gone and my feet look SO soft and healthy now. The summer is almost over but I would not be at all embarassed to wear sandals or slingback heels. I'm experiencing minor discomfort on the ball of my left foot where it's peeling but it hurts less than a papercut.<br /><br />The directions say not to peel the skin by hand, to just let it fall off on its own. To avoid a mess of dead skin rubbing off while I sleep, I've been rubbing my feet in a circular motion with a damp towel after getting out of the shower. If you choose to do this, a word to the wise, put a trashcan or towel under you when you do, it's a huge mess.<br /><br />Like I said, I've tried so many different methods and this is the only on that has made any kind of difference.   522. These are amazing. They're effective. They are the weirdest, longest pedicure process I've ever undergone. It took several days for the peeling to begin. After I applied the booties, the skin on my feet felt &#34;tight&#34;, as if my skin was no longer big enough for my feet, until it started peeling. And then once it starts peeling...ooh, boy. You do not want to go anywhere where your bare feet will be visible. The peeling process is a slow process, taking up to a full week. If you get a good strip to start loosening up, go ahead and peel it. It's oddly gratifying to remove sheets of dead skin. Just be cautious to not be overly aggressive with peeling. Don't peel where it's not clearly loose and easy to lift. The layer of skin under the dead skin needs to toughen up just a bit before it's exposed. If you peel too aggressively, you will make yourself a tender foot and be limping around a day or so! (Ask my husband about his experience with this!) The soles of my feet came off in almost one big piece. It was half gross/half fascinating. They WORK. My feet weren't excessively gross or scaly, but it took 2 treatments, 2 weeks apart to get them really soft. My husband's feet were stereotypical gross man-feet with thick, crusty turtle-shell like man-leather for soles. His crazy thick skin took 3 treatments, 2 weeks apart to get nice and soft. Maintain with a good foot cream with lactic acid in it after your peeling is complete. We like the O'Keeffe's Healthy Feet, conveniently also sold here on Amazon!<br /><br />I think that if that Buffalo Bill guy from Silence of the Lambs had this product, he would have had to capture and kill way less people to make his people-leather suit. He could have just given all of his friends pedicures and then been their designated peeler. So get these! Not only will you not have to put the lotion in the basket, you also won't get the hose again!

No pain at all but I did not peel back any of the skin myself. I continued to soak each night and applied cream so the dryness wouldn't make me crazy. Highly recommend this product to anyone with uncomplicated healthy feet in need of exfoliation. Side note - I think this product needs to be used a couple of weeks prior to doing any major walking as the loss of callous might cause sensitivity if activity is too intense right after peeling.
  553. It worked as promised - but be prepared for many days of peeling. Very thick calluses require multiple treatments. Maintenance with a pumice would probably be just as good.

  555. The delivery was fine but the product itself didn't work for me and left me with some painful cracks in my heels.<br />Followed the directions. Will never use again!

Initially I was hesitant since they are a bit pricey. Then on day 3 I started noticing my skin peeling around my ankles and toes. By days 4 and 5 the peeling really took off. And now on day 6 I am still peeling and most of the skin has flaked off.<br /><br />The skin really comes off when you are showering as well as putting socks on. And boy will you need socks, or you will shed like a freaking reptile all over the place.<br /><br />I honestly have no idea how the stuff works, but it does. Currently at 85% complete on shedding.   590. I don't remember where I first heard about Baby Foot, but I was intrigued right away. I searched the Internet, and found glowing reviews, as well as pictures of people with skin peeling off ALL OVER THEIR FEET! Amazing! It sounded like the perfect answer to the dry skin on my heels. It seemed too good to be true, but I finally decided to give it a try, and ordered It.<br /><br />I followed the directions on the package, also using suggestions made by a reviewer who gave a detailed description of how to get good results. I soaked my feet in warm water for half an hour, then put on the booties containing the Baby Foot gel, and a pair of warm socks. I sat back for an hour and a half, waiting for the gel to do its work, before soaking my feet again for 30 minutes. Yippee! It would only be a matter of time until my feet started to peel! Every day, I looked at the pictures again, and soaked my feet in warm water for 30 minutes. I didn't start feeling discouraged until a week had passed, and not one flake of skin had peeled. It has now been two weeks, and nothing has happened. I don't have elephant skin - I'm a redhead, and my skin burns and peels after less than an hour in the sun. I don't see how it couldn't have worked.<br /><br />So now I feel like a sucker. I haven't felt this ripped off since I was eight years old, and bought Sea Monkeys, thinking that they would actually look like monkeys and have little crowns and everything like they did in the picture, and finding out they were just little specks in water.

I expected my feet to look soft, but they also look younger! My ankles look young lol! I know that's weird to say but they do! I am so happy with the results! It was completely painless. The new skin is a TINY BIT sensitive but not so much that I could wear heels to work all day. It didn't hurt but it just freaked out everyone else, i just laughed. The skin that I cut off felt like a latex glove, this was crazy, but it left behind soft pretty feet.

Use this product and dont go back to scraping your feet with a pumice because that is what creates the problem in the first place.   666. This really worked! I have a problem with chronic dry, cracked skin on my heels and toes because I go barefoot year-round and I understand that walking on carpet is very drying. I do have pedicures but they can never completely remove the deeply cracked skin on my heels and at the ends of my toes. I tried these booties one evening. They are cheaper than a pedicure and I don't have to shave my legs and leave the house, so I thought it was worth a try! After a few days the skin on the tops of my feet started to peel off, easily scrubbed off in the shower, and then the tougher skin around the sides and bottoms of my feet. To speed up the process (mainly because I was leaving skin flakes on the sheets) I soaked my feet in a foot bath and gently brushed off the flakes, changing the water when it cooled off several times. My feet are still peeling a little but the change is amazing! My heels haven't been this smooth in memory! Now that the tough skin is gone I'm going to start moisturizing and wearing socks (am I the only one who hates wearing socks because I'm constantly going from hot to cold, socks on, socks off?) so I can keep my feet soft and smooth for as long as possible! Although this isn't a recommended usage I'll bet these booties would work wonders on my husband's dry, cracked elbows if I can figure out how to tape them on him! New product?

I did everything the box told me to do: Soak feet, wear plastic booties for 1 hour, then wash feet thoroughly. The exfoliation process did not begin for me until 4-5 days after. It was a really gross process because skin was everywhere, but I just wore socks. After the exfoliation process was complete (which took about 2 weeks) my feet are wonderful looking. Now, it did not remove hard spots (if that makes any sense) but I'm sure with continual use, over time it should soften it up. I do have Chilblains, so it aided in the exfoliation process for my two toes that always has skin peeling. I highly recommend this product! It did not burn my feet or cause any sensitivity or reaction to the ingredients found in the product. I do feel the price point is high since you only receive one treatment in the box. (1 pair for $25 depending on the seller). But overall this product does work!

WOW - on day 3 I couldn't believe what I saw....it was exactly as advertised - years of dead skin started peeling from my feet. When I looked down and saw the new skin that was emerging - I was stunned at just how gray looking my feet actually were (even after a pedicure). The new, fresh and colorful skin that was appearing was simply amazing!!!! On a scale of 1 - 100....I give this product a 200....yes, it is THAT GOOD!!!!. I will continue to use this product and have recommended it to all of my friends and family. One thing that really helped was the soaking the feet every day (I used a foot bath with vibrating bubbles and warm water)...However - this is NOT required. Thank you so much for introducing this product to the world!!!!!
  748. Worked as described but took longer than I thought. Didn't begin peeling until 5th or 6th day and continued peeling for another week, so almost 2 weeks total. But it did make the skin on my feet smoother. My heels are still dry and cracked but they were much worse and probably need more treatment than just this peel provides.
  749. Worked, feet started to peel after 10 days of waiting. The shedding process is messy, not sure I would do it again
  750. I paid extra thinking I was getting a 2 pack - I did not. Read the description carefully. The product worked as stated.
  751. Baby Foot definitely works as described -- all areas in the bootie will definitely peel. It took about 5 weeks total before they were fully peeled. 2 weeks before they started peeling and another 2-3 weeks of peeling. So, use it when you have several weeks before you want to take your feet public.
  752. Yes - it makes your feet peel, but not sure it gets to the problem areas. All my life I have had very delicate feet, and as I have gotten older, my feet aren't as soft. The first time I tried this product, and after following the directions, my feet peeled in almost every spot - except for around my big toe on each foot. I will edit this review in a couple weeks after a have tried again.
  753. Well it wasn't life changing - as some of the reviews could lead you to believe, but I was overall impressed with the results. Takes about 14 days from the start time to fully see results. From about days 5-10 your feet peel so badly you need to wear socks all of the time. Doesn't hurt though and is easy to follow the instructions.<br />You can see my detailed review, along with pictures, on my blog at www.chiefhouseholdofficer.net/babyfoot/
  754. Bad design of bootie puts exfoliating gel all over feet. This ate away the thin skin on the tops of my feet and around toes. I had followed the directions. I could not wear sandals as they cut through the thin damaged skin. I had to wrap my feet in gauze. Blistered and bled for a month. Very painful. Now the tops of my feet are scarred. I contacted the manufacturer. They requested receipts and pictures. After I sent them and they saw the damage to my feet the company ignored me. It is ridiculous to put the strong chemicals that remove callouses on the tops of feet. Horrid careless design. Stay away from this product.
  755. Great does everything it claims to<br />At first you will think it's not working but after about five day that skin is falling off. ( make sure you have a hand held vacuum you'll find skin all over the place LOL)<br />Feet will continue to peel for about two weeks but you can really feel and see the difference
  756. This product is amazing! I have I am usually in sandals and my heels are always a mess, this worked MIRACLES! I already did a reorder for when I need to use it again, but even after a few months my feet are still in great shape. It does mess with polish so don't do your nails before you use it :)
  757. This just removed my nail polish. Maybe I gave baby feet.
  758. As effective as promised, and as disgusting as you can imagine. But fascinating if you aren't too squeamish about dealing with quantities of your own dead skin. It didn't get totally rid of my most seriously built up calluses, but there was dramatic improvement, especially to heels. I will definitely purchase again.
  759. I go barefoot a lot so my feet are usually a mess. After an hour in these booties all the ugly dry skin just peels away in about 5-7 days. I'm going to put it in my routine. My shoes even feel better because there aren't any callouses making pressure points anywhere. I experimented with the presoak. One foot was soaked, one was not. The presoaked foot peeled sooner and more completely. next time soaking them both.
  760. I am 50 and this is the first beauty product I have purchased that has exceeded my expectations. My heels have never been this soft! The product did fade my toenail polish and the first week of peeling was not very attractive when I wore sandals, but the rsults was well worth it.
  761. This is the first time I've ordered this product, but I will absolutely be doing it again. The booties system isn't exactly comfortable, but the results are totally worth it. Its been a few days, and my feet have already begun peeling. The skin underneath looks so fresh and soft! But honestly, the best part is the peeling. There's SO much peeling. Maybe its the compulsiveness in me, but I love sitting around and peeling up the dead skin from my feet. I wouldn't recommend this product if you're grossed out easily.
  762. Great product. Beware of the all natural pitch. This product has harmful chemicals. Go to the environmental working group's website and plug in the list of ingredients.
  763. So I made my husband try this and he really didn't want to but I put my foot down (ha ha) and for the next two weeks his athlete's foot was worse than ever but then all the skin peeled off and now he doesn't stink up the house with his yucky foot smell. Oh, and his feet aren't all white and dry anymore - basically he seems to be free from athletes foot. He said it felt &#34;tingly&#34; during the one hour that he wore the booties but no pain at anytime. He did have a flare up of athlete's foot so we used some cream for athlete's foot and then that seemed to fix it. That was at day 8 and the peeling continued until day 14. I plan on doing this again for him in 6 months. Love it.
  764. Works well...my feet are still peeling, so not sure of full end result, but so far so good and the best product I have used for foot exfoliation!
  765. Didn't work smelled nice. Yes I followed the directions etc
  766. Is this a joke? I feel so ripped off. (And how do you return an item like this?) If it did anything, it made my feet more dry.
  767. So I read all the reviews, soaked my feet prior to the application of Baby Foot, soaked my feet in the ensuing days... I barely got a peel. It did something, but not much. I'll be looking for another product.
  768. very good product. I was pleased with the results. Did what it claimed it would do whch is exfoliate, or remove, the dead skin from my feet. Was having real problems with corns, bunions, etc but now problem is solved!!!
  769. I saw excellent reviews of this product. I was left disappointed. Some of the old, dry skin pealed off, but my feet are not any more soft or fresh looking. I'd rather just spend money on a pedi.
  770. This stuff is amazing. Easy to use. Just put some plastic socks on, wait, rinse. In about 4-7 days your feet will start peeling. Then they will peel more. And then some more. Then a little more. They will just continue to peel until you think you won't have any feet left. Then BAM its done, and you realize HOW SOFT YOUR FEET ARE! This product has made SUCH a significant difference. There is nothing else like it that I've tried. I recommend to anyone who asks about it. Give it a shot - you won't be disappointed.
  771. Works. Nuff said. Get it.
  772. Fast shipping but product does not really work. It does leave feet soft...but does not remove dead skin. I would not buy this again.
  773. I've told so many people about Baby Foot. I'm probably known as &#34;the Crazy Baby Foot Lady&#34; around the office. But once my coworkers try this stuff I'll be known as &#34;the Brilliant Baby Foot Lady&#34;, so whatever. Last laugh and all.
  774. I already had smooth feet but wanted to try these to see if I could get even smoother feet. The answer: Yes! My feet peeled for 2-3 weeks and are even smoother. Hard to believe. I even had someone recently comment on how smooth my feet were. Great product!
  775. the tops of feet peeled
  776. This is a great product...you should do this in March or late April if you want to have pretty feet for the summer.
  777. I was a skeptic but I figured it was worth a try. Besides, I've thrown $25 away on worse things. It blew me away. I kept the booties on for about 2hrs while I watched a ball game and about day 4, this product meant business!! The only downside was that I had to wear socks 24hrs/day but the outcome was well worth the wait. My feet are very rigid. I mean I could walk a mile barefoot over busted glass without flinching but Baby Foot took that tough skin away. For others with similar polynesian feet like mine, I would recommend this product... and continual use.
  778. I have dinosaur feet. I didn't always have them but after returning from a Virgin Islands trip 10 years ago I began to notice my feet becoming really rough in spots (heel, lower side section of big toe and side of pinky toe). I went to a podiatrist and she tested for fungus etc but found nothing. So, my days of scraping and moisturizing and wearing socks to bed because I was embarrassed for my husband to accidentally touch my feet during the night began.<br /><br />The best product I had found before I discovered a blurb in a magazine about Baby Foot was pure Shea Butter. It was a daily process however and if I skipped a day I noticed it would take 3 days of constant use to \\"catch up\\" with fairly smooth feet.<br /><br />I had read enough positive reviews of Baby Foot to decide to give it a try. I was a bit leery of it being a Japanese product but then realized I was probably being paranoid because of radiation fears (yeah, that is a whole other story). The product I received came from Liberta U.S.A. Inc. so I am guessing they are the U.S. distributor now for this Japanese product.<br /><br />The product I received came in the red box with American English print with a photo of a woman's feet (not the photo of a leg shown on the red box here at Amazon currently). It says Lavender scent on the front. The instructions on the back say the booties will fit Woman size 4-12 and Men 4-13 (American I am assuming).<br /><br />After reading all the inconsistent reviews of results I decided to compare the ingredients in the different packaging types and found differences. Some of these differences were in ingredients themselves and some just in the order of the ingredients (we all know the listed order of the ingredients determines the percentage of the ingredient in the product). I won't go into all the different ingredients or order differences but I will compare here a couple of really noticeable differences in the Liberta USA Inc. product I received and the red box American text with the womans legs and her hand on her calf. One of the first differences in MY box and the box shown here on Amazon is the ingredient Salicylic Acid. Now we ladies all know that ingredient from our facial masks and creams. It is a good ingredient (unless you have ultra sensitive skin or a condition such as Rosacea) to have in a product that promises to get rid of dead topical skin. Amazon here lists it as ingredient number 9. My box lists it as ingredient number 32! In fact, there are so many oil and extract ingredients listed on MY red box list before ANY of the acids (with exception of the lactic acid) that it is clear that the U.S. distributed product is a completely different product than what the Japanese had originally produced. I don't know if this is because our FDA deemed the actual acid concentration too high for sale in the U.S. or if it is just because Americans are just economically dumb and will buy anything made more cheaply even if it is ineffective.<br /><br />So, that said, I opened the package and found two clear, thin, boxy booty bags. The gel was visable inside. I had to use scissors to cut the very top of the booties. I cut the tops of the booties at the same time. I recommend you cut and put on one at a time however because it could get messy. I was very careful and inserted each foot. I didn't notice any type of offensive or chemical type odor but I didn't really detect Lavender either (and I use a LOT of lavender products so I am well acquainted with it). My box came with a strip of plastic sealing tape pieces. The plastic did feel very thin and I wouldn't be comfortable walking around in just them or even propping them up for fear that the gel could leak out somehow. Fortunately, I own a pair of large furry booty slippers that make me look like a muppet from the calf down so I slipped my bagged feet into those.<br /><br />The instructions on MY box says to leave them on for only 1 hour. Then wash feet with soap. The dead skin cells will begin to peel 2-7 days after initial application. I left product on for two hours after I knew that the amount of acid was reduced in this version. I really don't understand why the leave on time is LESS time with LESS acid ingredients? You would think the less effective ingredient list would require MORE time on the feet. Anyway, after two hours I removed the booties and washed my feet and thoroughly dried. I didn't feel any weird tingling or burning of any kind. My feet did feel a bit warmer to the touch than usual however but that is probably because they were in baggies inside muppet slipper boots for two hours.<br /><br />I dried my feet and didn't apply any moisturizer of any kind at first. The instructions do say that if your feet feel dry you apply a small amount of moisturizer. It took 3 days to start noticing a bit of sloughing. My feet didn't get scaly but there was not a \\"dramatic\\" amount of peeling after 3 days. It looks more like if you are in the tub 10 minutes too long and you start getting that whitish soft ring around the edge of the heel?<br /><br />I am writing this on day 3 because I wanted to get the differences of the product information out to you guys now. I will be updating in about 3 more days and then give you my final thoughts/results after a full 14 days after the initial use of this product. I will let you know what I am using in addition to this product in the next 11 days as well. I am going to do nothing to one foot (as a \\"control\\") and then if I use Shea Butter etc I will use it on the other foot exclusively.<br /><br />EDIT: It has been 7 days since I first applied the product. My heels feel like they are sore. Not a burning sore just like if I have been standing all day. My feet are finally starting to slough and peel. However, only the tops of my feet. A thin layer of skin can be peeled off much like the skin after a sunburn except there is no redness. The bottoms of my feet are not visably peeling nor are they softer. I suspect it is because the Baby Foot product I purchased is a different formula then the original Japanese product that comes in the box with the Japanese writing. I have not tried the product packaged in the Japanese box but I know that there is far less acid in the Baby Foot product that I received. I think this less acid is the reason there is no sloughing on the bottom of my foot. The way the bag booties fit with the gel inside makes it impossible to concentrate the gel solely on the bottoms of the feet.<br /><br />EDIT: 9 days after applying product. I woke up this morning to the bottoms and sides of my feet finally peeling! I am peeling off large pieces of skin to reveal new baby soft skin. I had to scrape with my nail a bit to get the heel sections off but my skin didn't tear like I was afraid it might. So, it worked after all. It just took longer than I expected. I do recommend this product but as others have mentioned, make sure you give yourself a good two weeks after initial application before you have to reveal your feet to anyone. I would like to have the gel formula in a jar or bottle so that I could apply it to my heels only sometimes.<br /><br />EDIT: Someone asked me today if I noticed my feet getting rough again after the initial effects of the treatment. YES. Two weeks after the initial smoothness (meaning after all the peeling was done) my feet were close to being right back to where they were before the treatment. This is why in my review I mentioned that it would be nice to have a bottle of the solution alone for periodic maintenance. I am back to having to apply creams such as shea butter nightly. As it stands now, plan on this method of softening to be for an event or vacation because it isn't a long term solution.th soap. The dead skin cells will begin to peel 2-7 days after initial application. I left product on for two hours after I knew that the amount of acid was reduced in this version. I really don't understand why the leave on time is LESS time with LESS acid ingredients? You would think the less effective ingredient list would require MORE time on the feet. Anyway, after two hours I removed the booties and washed my feet and thoroughly dried. I didn't feel any weird tingling or burning of any kind. My feet did feel a bit warmer to the touch than usual however but that is probably because they were in baggies inside muppet slipper boots for two hours.<br /><br />I dried my feet and didn't apply any moisturizer of any kind at first. The instructions do say that if your feet feel dry you apply a small amount of moisturizer. It took 3 days to start noticing a bit of sloughing. My feet didn't get scaly but there was not a \\"dramatic\\" amount of peeling after 3 days. It looks more like if you are in the tub 10 minutes too long and you start getting that whitish soft ring around the edge of the heel?<br /><br />I am writing this on day 3 because I wanted to get the differences of the product information out to you guys now. I will be updating in about 3 more days and then give you my final thoughts/results after a full 14 days after the initial use of this product. I will let you know what I am using in addition to this product in the next 11 days as well. I am going to do nothing to one foot (as a \\"control\\") and then if I use Shea Butter etc I will use it on the other foot exclusively.<br /><br />EDIT: It has been 7 days since I first applied the product. My heels feel like they are sore. Not a burning sore just like if I have been standing all day. My feet are finally starting to slough and peel. However, only the tops of my feet. A thin layer of skin can be peeled off much like the skin after a sunburn except there is no redness. The bottoms of my feetare not visably peeling nor are they softer. I suspect it is because the Baby Foot product I purchased is a different formula then the original Japanese product that comes in the box with the Japanese writing. I have not tried the product packaged in the Japanese box but I know that there is far less acid in the Baby Foot product that I received. I think this less acid is the reason there is no sloughing on the bottom of my foot. The way the bag booties fit with the gel inside makes it impossible to concentrate the gel solely on the bottoms of the feet.<br /><br />EDIT: 9 days after applying product. I woke up this morning to the bottoms and sides of my feet finally peeling! I am peeling off large pieces of skin to reveal new baby soft skin. I had to scrape with my nail a bit to get the heel sections off but my skin didn't tear like I was afraid it might. So, it worked after all. It just took longer than I expected. I do recommend this product but as others have mentioned, make sure you give yourself a good two weeks after initial application before you have to reveal your feet to anyone. I would like to have the gel formula in a jar or bottle so that I could apply it to my heels only sometimes.<br /><br />EDIT: Someone asked me today if I noticed my feet getting rough again after the initial effects of the treatment. YES. Two weeks after the initial smoothness (meaning after all the peeling was done) my feet were close to being right back to where they were before the treatment. This is why in my review I mentioned that it would be nice to have a bottle of the solution alone for periodic maintenance. I am back to having to apply creams such as shea butter nightly. As it stands now, plan on this method of softening to be for an event or vacation because it isn't a long term solution.
  779. Like the other reviewers of this product I was amazed at how well this product works! It really did leave my feet super soft and supple, but it took several days of shedding dead skin to get to that point. I followed the advice of other reviewers and soaked my feet before using the booties, and then continued to soak my feet nightly thereafter in order to speed up the exfoliation process. It took about 10 days to go through the entire exfoliation and finally get to the point where I could comfortably show my feet in public. In the meantime, going to my regular yoga classes was a little awkward. I didn't want anyone looking at my peeling, flaking skin. Plus, my boyfriend was curious to know why I all-of-a-sudden started wearing socks around the house when we're normally both barefoot. I suppose I could've just explained that I was wearing the socks to keep all the dead skin that was peeling off my feet from being tracked all over the floor. However, I think that even after being together for a very long time there are still some things about a woman's beauty routine that should remain a mystery to her partner. Over all, I would recommend this product to anyone who has neglected to keep up with a regular exfoliation routine. This will help you get back on track. But its not a product that I want to use on a regular basis just because of how much time it takes to get through the whole process. Now that I've been through it once I've worked to keep up with a regular soaking and exfoliating routine so that hopefully I won't have to go through the process again. I'm at least glad to know that I have a fall back plan in case I need it.
  780. I followed the instructions exactly - presoaked my feet, used a timer, washed my feet off with soap and water. It's been 8 days and nothing has happened except now my feet are REALLY dry and cracked.
  781. Awesome treatment for dry & rough feet. I left my feet in the treatment booties for 2 hours. I also soaked my feet in water for 10 minutes prior to starting & dried well. I soaked my feet in water everyday or every other day for about 20 minutes after initial treatment day also. Did not do anything else to feet as I waited for peel to begin which occurred about day 5. Feet start to look funky in a few days while building up to day 5, but no peeling until day 5 for me. If you have an event or somewhere special to go in the days following the treatment, don't expect to wear open shoes!! You start molting and it goes from about day 5-10. End result is soft feet though!! Purchased a second box to repeat treatment in a few months! One box is for 1 treatment.

Then used them about a week after the pedicure again - then another pedicure. My feet are healed and so much softer than they have ever been.

  796. Okay, so my husband has some nasty feet. He works in the Louisiana heat all day in steel toe boots, so naturally his feet get pretty sweaty in his socks. He had layers upon layers of dead, dry, wrinkled skin that would itch as soon as he got out of the shower. I tried, in vain, to get him to go for a pedicure. He refused- not because he felt it was too &#34;girly&#34; for him, but because his feet are so incredibly ticklish that he just couldn't handle it (I can't even graze the bottom of his feet at night by accident without him having a full body spasm and freaking out). After searching for something to help him, I came across this product. He agreed to try it- he was all for being forced to sit down for an hour and letting the acid do its work. So, I ordered and we followed all of the steps on the package as well as the tips from previous reviewers.<br />Awesome results. A few things you may want to know, though:<br />1. Your feet will peel for about 2 weeks. Constantly. You will have chunks of dead skin in your socks by the end of the day.<br />2. This product not only removes the dead skin on the surface, but it moisturizes the new skin underneath.<br />3. This is not a long-term solution. Hubby's feet were back to looking ragged about a week after the peeling stopped. The itching is gone and hasn't come back, but I can't see ordering this and doing it once a month- which is what we would need to do in order to keep the initial results up. For people who get what is essentially trench foot every day at work, this product isn't for you. If your feet aren't constantly exposed to harsh work environments, if you have a desk job, if you have otherwise normal feet, you will love this.
  797. I wish it was as strong as the japanese version. It did make my feet itchy. This was one of those few times I wish I had read all comments before use. If you soak your feet every day after for a few minutes, it will help your feet peel better. With my hubby's manly feet, i talked him into using this so as not to feel like I'm sleeping with sandpaper every night. His feet did not peel until the 12th day when I finally read he should soak his feet. Then they peeled a bit. Second time I got him to use it, which was a battle and a half, whenever he was in the shower we stopped up the tub a bit while he washed his hair. Giving him a bit of a soak without him feeling like he was doing something girly. It worked well. So soaking is the way to go! They worked for me easily and I was peeling without soaking, then again I keep my feet really nice.<br /><br />I think I'd still like to try the stronger version, if possible. But if not, I'd simply buy this one again. I think twice a year would be great for anyone who keeps their feet nice. If you have foot issues, you might want to do it far more often? But I am no expert.
  798. The first time I used this, I said never again this is disgusting, then I saw the results.<br />I use this every 6 to 8 weeks in the winter. I don't know how you can use this in the summer.<br />I have found the easiest way to use this is to put the bag on your foot,I put duct tape around the ankle ( the pieces of tape that come with it are basically useless) and a pair of socks on top. I leave it on for about an hour and a half.<br />Your feet start peeling about 5 or 6 days after you use this, and they keep peeling for about a week. Then you have baby feet !!!

Nothing happened for about 5 days and then my feet were sloughing like i poured elmers glue on it. It was grossly satisfying to peel off strips of skin. I soaked my feet probably every other night and used a one of those cheese grater type foot files- my feet were considerably smoother but never became like baby foot smooth. They also looked just as bad as they ever did in about 2 weeks. The sloughing period is extreme- don't even think about wearing any kind of sandals for a while.   806. Awesome product. Cleared all my calluses!! My feet are very smooth!! takes about a week to 8 days.
  807. I watch videos of everyone using this and I expected it to do way more than it did. I won't be buying this product again.
  808. This product does exactly what is claims to do. I get pedicures often, but salons don't file or scrub hard enough to get all of the dead skin off of my feet. I had a lot of calluses on the ball of my foot and especially my heel. It was so bad that no matter what I did (bathed, scrubbed, and even soak in bleach), my heels ALWAYS looked dirty.<br /><br />I am currently on day six of my baby foot treatment and as two days ago, the peeling has started. Last night, large sheets of skin came off my heel as well as the sole of my foot. My feet were extremely bad. This is what I did:<br /><br />The product recommends using the booties for an hour. Wednesday night, I slept in mine. I did not soak me feet prior. I inserted my foot, taped, and slipped socks over them and went to sleep. In the morning, I washed my feet and wore closed toe shoes with socks. Note: Overnight it ate the gel polish off my toes nails. I experienced no pain at all.<br /><br />Two days later I was skeptical, I figured it wouldn't work on feet as bad as mine. The 2nd day, the peeling started on the top of my foot. I used it Wednesday night. I soaked my feet for an hour everyday, dried them, and then put back on socks.<br /><br />On the fifth day, the bottom of my feet peeled like CRAZY! I began using a metal foot file, and pumice stone to help get the skin off. It even peels the extra skin off of your toes. I wish I could upload a picture, because it is amazing. The skin underneath is new soft, and it feels so good. Now, after I soak, I dry, file and scrub (because my feet were just that bad). I also use Glytone before I put my socks on.<br /><br />Try not to pull the skin off and be patient.<br /><br />Buy it. Use it. You won't regret it!
  809. It worked very well. Be patient it does not start to peel for 5 to 6 days. I take great care of my feet and was surprised how much skin came off for about 2 weeks. I will purchase again and highly recommend this product.

  862. I was skeptical of this product since I have pretty thick calluses, but this product worked better than any pedicure I have ever gotten at a spa. It was completely painless, my feet looked 100% better within a week, and it was cheaper than getting a spa pedicure. That having been said, here are a few tips that I found that helped me get optimal results:<br /><br />1) Soak your feet in plain warm water before putting on the plastic booties. Soak them for at least 15 minutes (longer if your feet are really rough, like mine were.)<br /><br />2) Find a spot to sit in where you plan to hang out for awhile before you put the booties on. Once they are on, they are really slippery and it is very hard to walk around. Gather up all of the stuff you will want/need before you open the package.<br /><br />3) Open the booties and put them on one at a time. The gel inside tends to leak out if you open the package and then lay the bootie down. This mess can be avoided by putting one bootie on before cutting the second one open.<br /><br />4) Once the booties are on, put a thick pair of socks over the booties. This holds the bootie on more securely and helps the gel penetrate your calluses more deeply.<br /><br />5) The package says to leave the product on for only 30 minutes (I have seen on other reviews that some packages recommend 1-2 hours.) To get the best results, decide how bad your calluses are, and then leave the booties on for the amount of time you need. If you have nice, pretty feet, you won't need to leave it on for more than an hour. If you have nasty thick calluses like I did, you will want to leave the booties on longer. I left the booties on for 6 hours with no side effects.<br /><br />6) When it is time to take the booties off, wash your feet thoroughly with warm soapy water.<br /><br />7) Your feet will start to feel tight, like your skin is very dry. This is totally normal and is part of the process. DO NOT PUT LOTION ON - this will stop the peeling process and will defeat the whole purpose of the treatment.<br /><br />8) Your feet will start peeling within 3-7 days, and will keep shedding dead skin for at least a week. This is normal. Do not apply lotion, or it will stop the process.<br /><br />9) As tempting as it may be, do not manually peel the skin off if it is not yet peeling. This can damage the healthy skin underneath the dead skin. Trust me, the dead skin will come off all by itself.<br /><br />10) Each person is different. Some shed skin in small pieces, while others have entire sheets of skin come off at once. Be patient with the process.<br /><br />11) I applied this treatment to my feet about 5 days ago, and my feet are about 85% done peeling. If you are doing this to prepare for a wedding/cruise/special event, give yourself ample time for the peeling process to complete. Don't apply this treatment just a few days before a big event, or you may still have ugly feet on the big day. Give yourself at least two weeks for the process to be complete.process and will defeat the whole purpose of the treatment.<br /><br />8) Your feet will start peeling within 3-7 days, and will keep shedding dead skin for at least a week. This is normal. Do not apply lotion, or it will stop the process.<br /><br />9) As tempting as it may be, do not manually peel the skin off if it is not yet peeling. This can damage the healthy skin underneath the dead skin. Trust me, the dead skin will come off all by itself.<br /><br />10) Each person is different. Some shed skin in small pieces, while others have entire sheets of skin come off at once. Be patient with the process.<br /><br />11) I applied this treatment to my feet about 5 days ago, and my feet are about 85% done peeling. If you are doing this to prepare for a wedding/cruise/special event, give yourself ample time for the peeling process to complete. Don't apply this treatment just a few days before a big event, or you may still have ugly feet on the big day. Give yourself at least two weeks for the process to be complete.

  1001. This stuff works great!! It took exactly 7 days for my feet to start peeling. It's a little gross when they do but hey isn't that what you want. I used it twice, 2 weeks apart and my feet feel wonderful. I think the price is a little high but you do get what you pay for because it really works. One thing I did when my feet started peeling was soak them in Epsom salt and then it was easier and cleaner to roll the skin off my feet.
  1002. Amazing product - removed a ton of calloused skin. I read reviews saying it was critical to soak feet for a good hour before using it and periodically until they begin to peel. I did it before but forgot after. The directions don't stress pre-soaking and I suspect that folks who didn't find it helpful didn't know about this tip. On day 3 it felt like I had a piece of paper stuck to the bottom of my foot, but it turned out to be a flapping piece of skin. I was leaving a little trail of them! I quickly put down a sheet and gently rubbed off all that was ready to be removed. Over the next couple of days a disgusting (but fascinating) amount of dead skin and callous sloughed off. I had to keep on socks or I would have left trails all over the place. The bad news is that I found out my callouses actually served a purpose. Shortly after treatment I spent 2 different days working on physical projects that kept me on my feet a lot. Both days I had on shoes that normally were very comfortable and supportive for this sort of activity - and both days my feet were very uncomfortable before the day was over. I wasn't sure if it was just one of those delightful things we discover as we age, or if it was the Baby Foot treatment. I let my callouses grow back I could do those types of things in those same work shoes without discomfort. So while I loved how my feet looked, lack of pain trumps pretty in my world so I won't be using this again. Well, maybe if there is a very special event coming up then I'll just let my feet go back to the wild :)<br /><br />I still gave it a pretty high score because I think my reaction wasn't standard and that most folks will be pleased with the results.
