  1009. It really works! In about 4 days the dead skin began to peel. Given I soak and exfoliate my feet pretty regularly, I was shocked that there was so much shedding. The pictures only show skin coming off the bottom of individual's feet, so I wasn't prepared for the skin that continued to peel on top and to the ankle. Even my toes were smoother and softer. At 2 weeks there was still some shedding, but then subsided a little after the 2 week mark. These results may not be true for others.<br />UPDATE (6 weeks later):<br />It's true the shedding process did work. But since that time, I notice my feet appear to be dryer than before using the product. Before I didn't have cracks in my heels and now they are dry and not as smooth as before. Perhaps this should only be used by those with extreme dryness or cracked heels. Since I usually don't have that problem, I will not be using this again.

  1017. My feet, and especially heels, were ROUGH (and thick). This worked perfectly... But I put in the work.<br /><br />Soaked my feet for 15 minutes prior to using, put the booties on, put some fuzzy sleep socks over them, and settled in for some grey's anatomy. Rinsed it off and went to bed.<br /><br />On day 3 I started using the pumice stone in the shower - a few minutes per foot - really working at the heel. Once out of the shower you could see all of the roughed up skin. I'd pick at it for a few minutes (for fun, obviously), then slather on some cracked heel lotion and go about my day. I'd add some more lotion right before bed. I've been repeating this everyday and now on day 8 my foot is literally transformed. Just some peeling to finish around the toes and ankle. I didn't do any additional soaks, just the shower scrubbing and lots of lotion. On day 8 I did also use a mixture of melted coconut oil and plain white sugar to scrub the tops of my feet to finish off that peeling. I plan to continue using that for the next few days as well.<br /><br />Most importantly: I'm not sure why the directions say not to use lotion... Maybe it just means right after the application??? I feel like lotion after exfoliating was the key to this whole thing.<br /><br />This stuff definitely works, but if you're expecting to just wake up one day and peel large sheets of skin off your feet, you're going to be disappointed.

  1019. This product works great but you have to make sure to follow the directions. Also, the other review person was right on the money concerning soaking the foot in warm water before and during the week. Also realize nothing will happen until (about) day 3. Do not expect to take the booties off and see perfect skin. This is the obvious case of those who are complaining it didn't do anything. You have to give it time. Also daily bath soaks help you get the most bang for your buck.<br /><br />DO NOT add lotion to your feet. The dead skin is supposed to dry and fall off. If you use lotion the lotion prevents the peel process.<br /><br />Also make sure you have clean socks on (or shoes) at all times. When all the dead skin comes off you are at risk of infection either bacteria or fungal if you don't keep your feet super clean while its working.

  1055. For years, my feet have been a dry, callused mess despite moisturizers, scrubs, bi-weekly pedicures, trips to the podiatrist... It's not uncommon for my cracked heels to begin to bleed, which began again a few weeks ago and lead me to search Google once again for a cure. I came across Baby Foot and thought &#34;what the heck...it's only $20 and worth a shot!&#34; I read all of the reviews of fabulous results but was still a bit skeptical.<br />My package arrived on 08/12 and I got excited. I soaked my feet for 30 minutes before applying the booties, then put on some thick socks over the booties and settled in on the couch ('cause you certainly can't walk around with these things on you feet) where I let the magic happen for the next two hours. I know the package insert says to use them for only one hour, but many reviews recommended an extended period of time. So, two hours go by and I carefully made my way to the bath to wash away the goo. I was SHOCKED when I removed the socks and booties...my feet were huge! Swollen to the point where my feet were like blocks. Given that the product is made of fruit acids, I thought it would be gentle, but it was powerful enough that it ate the polish right off my nails. The next morning, the swelling was down somewhat but didn't completely resolve for four days. Swollen feet = sore feet so no heels for me that week! For two days, nothing (except the swelling, oh and some redness) happened. My feet felt dry and tight. On day three, my feet started to peel, showing extremely red skin underneath, as if they were sunburnt. On day 5, I started to get worried...I looked like I had leprosy! There were huge pieces of skin falling off my feet, up my ankles, between my toes. It was disgusting to look at and I quickly learned that I couldn't walk around inside the house barefooted because I was leaving a trail of skin behind. I continued with nightly soaking of my feet for about thirty minutes, followed by a gentle rub to help remove the excess skin that was hanging in tattered strips on my feet. Now, 10 days after I started, the worst of the peeling is over with just a little flaking left behind on my ankles and the tops of my feet. My toenails are a bit of a mess; the product dried them out terribly so I'm applying oil to recondition my nails. But my feet? They look AMAZING! My dry cracked heels are a thing of the past. I am so excited with the results and despite the swelling, soreness, dried out nails and the horrible sight, I wouldn't hesitate to do this again.help remove the excess skin that was hanging in tattered strips on my feet.   1062. This product is a prayer answered! It works so well and does exactly what it says it will do. Easy to use (come on, you can sit still for 1 silly hour while the product is working!) . In about 5 day's the peeling began and lasted another 7 day's. I was skeptical as to whether it would peel those rough, dry, cracked heels of mine, but it did. I have not had soft, clean-looking feet like this for over 30 years….really!<br />I have always had pedicures and in between pumiced my feet to try to keep them nice, to no avail and tried every single heel and/or foot repair cream known with no luck. This product is amazing. Follow instructions exactly…..soak feet 15 min. in warm water, dry off then put booties on for 60 min., wipe dry then go wash them. Do NOT leave the product on for longer than 60 min.!! This is an acid-reactive product and the manufacturer has tested it. More time does not equal more results and could burn your skin, then you will blame the product and manufacturer unfairly. The amount of peeling will be based, of course, on how much dead skin you have so if you didn't get much peeling, your feet might have been in better condition than you thought, perhaps. Also, be prepared to forego your open sandals publicly for about 7 day's while the peeling process happens….it's not a pretty sight, but so, so worth it. Wearing lightweight socks around the house and to bed will eliminate flaking skin all over the place and grossing your family out! LOL! Truly, this is a product I was very impressed with….I just bought 2 more for the future. Thank you Baby Foot for an excellent product!
  1063. First off, I'll say I'm skeptical. I've tried tons of products promising new skin and heels so fancy, you'll never want to wear shoes, again. Nothing worked. My heels are probably typical of most women who go to the gym, wear sandals all summer, and wear those &#34;cute&#34; shoes that kill us. I use the Pedi Egg and various &#34;sanders&#34; from Beauty Brands each time I shower. Though the simple things like homemade foot scrubs, sanding, and lotion can help, nothing, and I mean nothing, worked like this product! After weeks and weeks of researching and humming and hawing, it went on sale and I bought it. Here's my tip to success: Soak feet. Take a nice long bath. I used bubbles, made myself some nice tea, brought in my iPad and watched about 40 minutes of TV to pass the time. (I hate baths. This part was the hardest for me.) Then I dried my feet a little, and while still prune toed from the bath, slipped the pre-gel booties on and put on a pair of my husband's socks over them to help keep them in place. I left mine on for 90 mins (suggested by a blogger) and then rinsed them off. My feet had a sheen to them and smelled nice but that was it. A watched foot does not peel. Day 2: Soaked just my feet in a foot bath for 30 mins. Nothing exciting but my feet felt relaxed from the hot water. Day 3: Whoa. My big toe, previously callused, peeled a little. I couldn't help but pick a tiny bit to reveal all this new skin under what felt like a giant mound of dead skin. Day 4: The sides of my feet started to peel some along with my heels a tiny bit. I continued to soak daily from 20-45 mins. I also have been wearing socks and sneakers all week. I've also sent out texts to multiple friends who were disgusted. Day 5: The magic starts to happen! More peeling...even around my toenails where I thought nothing bad was happening. Apparently, dry dead skin resided there, too. Right now I'm on Day 8: The majority of the peeling is over. I have been taking daily foot soaks/baths, using a washcloth to rub off dead skin during the foot bath, and today I peeled a little by hand because I couldn't help myself. Not much more peeling is happening. There's a few bits here and there but as I lay in bed, rubbing my once sandpaper feeling feet together, images of silk feet pop in my head. They feel so nice and the cracks and calluses are gone! I'll probably shed another day or two and be done with it. I'll buy this product, again, and will recommend this over any expensive pedicure any woman dare try (and I've even done the pedi where they razor cut your skin off your heels!). This is worth it. I have felt no pain. My feet look amazing. There's really nothing to it besides trying to hide your feet during the molting. If you're diabetic or have allergic reactions to any of the fruit acids or alcohol, it's not recommended. If you &#34;help the peeling&#34; along, you could hurt yourself. Those are just some warnings on the package it comes in. Happy shedding, everyone!a washcloth to rub off dead skin during the foot bath, and today I peeled a little by hand because I couldn't help myself. Not much more peeling is happening. There's a few bits here and there but as I lay in bed, rubbing my once sandpaper feeling feet together, images of silk feet pop in my head. They feel so nice and the cracks and calluses are gone!   1092. I've tried this product before and enjoyed it, though it didn't take care of rougher spots on the heels or balls-joint on the larger toe. It most certainly gets your skin to peel over the course of a week-- I couldn't wear anything revealing of the feet until the peeling process was done.<br /><br />The instructions are easy, though it's not easy to sit still and do nothing for an hour (unless you're on Amazon, then it's easy). When you first boot the booties on, it feels like your encasing your feet in cold snot, which is unnerving. During the hour, I highly recommend wiggling your toes to hear the sloshy, ucky sound your feet will make while encased in this deceivingly sweet-smelling slime. Wash-off at the end of the hour is easy and leaves your feet feeling smooth and smelling like flowers.<br /><br />The next day, you may notice your feet look and feel about twenty years OLDER than they should be, considering all that stuff has absorbed into your skin, and now you're just waiting for the skin to come off.<br /><br />The peeling process is pretty fun, if not a little gross. It's way more fun and rewarding than peeling off sunburned skin, though. Afterwards, your feet do feel pretty good if not a little naked. I'd recommend wearing socks during the peeling process so you don't gross people out. It's pretty funky.<br /><br />If you've got a major case of biscuit feet (rough heels, etc), then this product may not be for you. It didn't work all that well for me on the rougher areas. Then again, I've got heels practically made of stone, so it might just be me.<br /><br />Even if it doesn't work for you, it'll be a major peeling experience you won't forget.

  1188. I was skeptical, so I gave it a whirl and here was my experience. I went for my standard pedicure on a Saturday AM. Later that evening, prior to using the prior I soaked my feet in a hot/warm soapy foot spa for 20-30 minutes. I rinsed & towel dried my feet. I opened the package - there are (2) booties with the product already inside of them. Opened up each bootie, one at a time and inserted my feet. It feels kind of cold and strange at first, but you acclimate. I used the provided tape to secure my booties and massaged the product around my foot - heel, toes, etc. I put big fluffy socks on over the plastic booties in case of an emergency, so I could walk without falling. It also made my feet extra warm and comfy. I sat in a recliner with my feet elevated for approximately an hour, maybe a little bit longer. (I watched one episode of Project Runway and answered some emails.) After taking off the booties, I immediately rinsed my feet in the foot spa (water had cooled by now). I dried off my feet with the towel and walked to the shower for a full rinse/cleansing. Someone else's review recommended doing daily foot soaks, so every night after work, I've been soaking for 20-30 minutes. I did this for several days. I didn't see anything happen until day #5 when I started to see a tiny hint of peeling under one of my big toes and a small area on my heel. I wasn't impressed. At the end of Day #5 I did another foot soak and there was SUBSTANTIAL peeling. The warm water clearly has loosened up a lot of what was happening under the skin. I used a washcloth to gently rub down my feet prior to getting into bed. I left a trail/pile of dead skin all over the floor. Be prepared to do some vacuuming/sweeping. This morning is day#6 and I'm pretty sure I have full-on leprosy. It's amazing how much my feet are peeling. My toes, full bottoms of my feet, the sides, heel, everything is peeling. I work from home on Fridays, so I was able to soak my feet this morning for about 45 minutes during a conference call and WOW, so much more skin started coming off. I am sort of disgusted and also pretty gratified to see the process/product working. I'll be curious to see how it continues to work over the next several days and the final result. I'll post pics if I can figure out how!<br />7.ing a conference call and WOW, so much more skin started coming off. I am sort of disgusted and also pretty gratified to see the process/product working. I'll be curious to see how it continues to work over the next several days and the final result.   1189. So when this product recently hit my email news banner, I had to check it out. Everyone knows, or should know, that the whole pedi egg, scraping,filing, shaving etc. does little except prepare your feet for more hardened skin and callouses. Having once had a macho musician boyfriend who stood a lot at work and at gigs and had terrible feet and to whom I gave secret homemade pedicures using my own magic remedy and to my feet whose favorite activities are getting the paper on the driveway in the morning and walking all day everywhere in bare feet, my curiosity was piqued. It is pricey for what it is. I am not going to do the day by day results approach as this has been fairly well covered by other reviews; instead I am going to add a few tips of my own to the process, should you decide to purchase Baby Foot. First off, it is way overpriced for what it is, and no, the lavender aroma is hardly noticeable. So....have you ever marinated meat before cooking it to break down the sinewy veins etc. and open up its flesh? Well, same thing here. Wash your feet with soap, and dry. Do NOT apply lotion as this blocks the next step. Put a towel on the bottom of your container and fill it with water as hot as you can stand it. Add about a ¼ cup of Epsom salts, white vinegar, pure cane sugar (this is the alpha hydroxyl acid ingredient mentioned in the product's list), and baking soda. Do NOT add soap as it is a drying agent. Add lavender oil to get that psychological boost that you are being infused...after all you just spent @$25 for this indulgence to make yourself feel special with this one-time use product, and you do want to feel \\"infused.\\" Rub your feet against the towel as you soak for additional exfoliation, and when the water cools, remove your feet and dry them thoroughly. Again, do NOT apply lotion. Use the pricey product as directed...I also put plastic produce bags over the booties secured with rubber bands and tilted my feet at an angle so the gel would congregate around my heels, and I rested my feet on a dry towel just in case there was any leakage. After using the product...as you have read, there may be varying results...I purposely let my feet get real bad before I tested Baby Foot so as to give it a fair playing field. I wouldn't recommend going to any soirees or events at which you will be exposing your feet as they will not be something anyone will want to see, and we ladies all know that we (and many men as well) always check out the footwear other women are wearing. Your feet at this stage will not be a thing of beauty that will be even promise to be a joy forever, and the gossip will be bursting at the seams. If you must reveal your feet however, apply and reapply a good sunscreen. Your skin is actually in a healing process, and like every peel process, the sun's rays will cause damage. Do not go barefoot at all, for any reason, except in the shower or pool of course. There is dirt everywhere which will get in your healing skin's pores, irritate it, and actually cause re-hardening (which yes, IS going to happen, even with Baby Foot.) While showering, use a pumice stone and a quality sugar scrub, and you know quality does not mean the Wallyworld's sale item. Finally go to bed looking sexy, with a good shea butter slathered on and clean socks over this....which is also a good way to walk around your house too or to apply before putting on closed shoes. I would recommend Baby Foot if you really need to spend money on yourself in a manner that does not include buying a ten pack at the same price. Or you could just follow the marinating instructions above and apply a paste of the same cane sugar, a bottle of aspirin, (the salicylic acid), apple, orange, lemon, and grapefruit juices, and baking soda, wrap up and make your own how-to You Tube video as you proceed. Most importantly, remember that this product, like any skin care one, is not a one time cure-all, and will need to be used repeatedly as maintenance. Overall, notworth the price....obviously a LOT of their profit is going into advertising.worth the price....obviously a LOT of their profit is going into advertising.

  1225. I did a lot of research before I purchased this product. The official website claimed that it was a &#34;gentle process&#34; I am very familiar with AHA's and how they work. I do weekly Lactic acid peels for acne scars so I know what an actual peel feels like.<br /><br />I soaked my feet, opened the booties up, taped at the ankles, then put on a pair of socks. I was planning to read a book while waiting for the peel to process. On my way from the bathroom to the living room some of the gel leaked from the top on to the sock. So I took the sock off, and a little gel rubbed on my finger tips. For people that have done peels that are 50% or higher getting acid on your fingers is a big no-no. The acid can quickly spread to other parts of your body from the oil on your skin and can cause burns. So, after changing socks, washing hands I was about 20 minutes into the peel. At that point my feet felt warm and cozy like a gentle peel BUT I noticed a warming sensation on my hands, arms, and face. I must have inadvertently touched my face in the process of changing my socks and washing my hands.<br /><br />It was pretty much game over at that point. The small amount of acid that leaked out felt like 85% Lactic acid peel. With our feet being one of the most porous parts of our body I did not feel comfortable continuing the peel. I washed my feet for about 15 minutes with soap and water, and my feet burned. I rinsed with baking soda and water to help neutralize the acid but the only relief was walking bare foot on my cold tile floor.<br /><br />I am not sure if I just had a bad batch and the formula was wrong, but it was far from being a gentle peel. Do not plan on doing anything for the day if you have sensitive skin or have never used AHA's.<br /><br />If you plan on using this product use gloves and duct tape the top of your booties.

It was pretty gross - in a good way...<br />Right now everything has peeled and looks great EXCEPT for the hard calloused ring around my heals (that is the important part!) I will soak again and hope it continues to work. If my heals do not peal I will lower my rating for sure. I think I would do it again but it is cost prohibitive.

After About 4 Days, My Feet Started Peeling A Bit, Like Other Reviewers Reported. Now, At Say 6, I Notice That A Good Soaking At The End Of Each Day Helps To Loosen The Dead Skin, And I Am Able To Use A Towel To Help Remove The Dead Skin Without Disrupting The Process Or Causing Any Pain. The Skin That Is Being Revealed Underneath Is Unbelievably Soft And I Can't Wait For The Rest Of The Dead Stuff To Come Off!<br />My Maintenance Plan includes Applying Moisturizer Nightly And Sleeping With Plastic Bags & Socks On My Feet At Least A Couple Of Times A Week. I read about this product on a blog somewhere and debated whether it would be a waste of money. Another commenter wrote a tip about soaking your feet well every day and that's what I did. By day 4, no sign of peeling and I was feeling like I had wasted my money, but on day 5, as I was rubbing my feet dry, they started peeling. I continued to soak them for an hour or so every day, then buff with a towel to help remove the peeling skin. Now, my heels are as smooth as a peach. The callus areas didn't peel off completely, that might take more applications, but I am very pleased with the results. Now I just have to keep my feet smooth and not let that dry skin occur again. I then could rub the upper sections of my feet and my toes to slough the skin off.   1294. We discovered that if you do this, Baby Foot works perfectly:<br /><br />1. Soak feet for about 15 minutes in plain water (in a large bowl or bucket or sink or bathtub: whatever holds warm water & both your feet).<br /><br />2. Use Baby Foot exactly as directed.<br /><br />3. Wash feet with soap and water, rinse, then soak feet again in plain water for about 15 minutes. So, schedule about 2 hours for the process listed in #1 through #3.<br /><br />4. If you don't see any sloughing or peeling after 2 to 4 days, then soak feet for about 30 minutes in plain water. When you take feet out of the water & blot dry, you will definitely see sloughing & peeling. If you continue to soak for another hour then you will see even more sloughing and peeling that you can begin to rub off. Sloughing & peeling will continue well-enough for several days without further soaking, and most of the dead & dry skin will come off, BUT<br /><br />5. if you continue to soak your feet in plain water for 30 minutes to an hour every other day or so, you will continue to see even more sloughing and peeling up to about two weeks AND it will thoroughly remove ALL dead & dry skin from your feet.<br /><br />Two friends & I discovered this after we used Baby Foot once (we didn't know about the above directions at that time), and Baby Foot worked perfectly for the one of us who takes daily body-baths (doesn't shower), worked well-enough for the one of us who took daily showers & occasional body-baths, and didn't seem to work at all for the one of us who Only takes showers (never body-baths). We were comparing notes a few days after we first used it, and the shower-only friend was complaining that it didn't work at all, absolutely no peeling whatsoever, and her feet looked exactly the way they did before she used Baby Foot. We carefully went over every detail about what we had each done to our feet since applying Baby Foot, and carefully went over the Baby Foot instructions, which included this one little item written only in the little Instruction Manual sheet included in the box, \\"Note: We recommend taking a footbath to enhance the effects BEFORE (sic) and AFTER (sic) using this product.\\"<br /><br />So we got out a large bowl, filled it with water, and had our shower-only friend soak her feet for 30 minutes, and voila! the dead & dry skin on her foot looked white & \\"loose\\", and she rubbed it with her finger and it started sloughing off. She put her feet back in the water & soaked for another hour, and when she took them out & blotted them with a towel there was peeling all over her toes and peeling & sloughing on her heels & the ball of her foot. The shower-only fried didn't soak her feet again, and after two weeks most of the dead & dry skin had come off well-enough. The other two of us soaked our feet every day (the bath-only friend) or every other day (the occasional-bath friend) for the next two weeks, and both of us ended up with every single bit of dead & dry skin removed, and had completely baby-soft feet.<br /><br />At different times all three of us have used it a second time after the initial use (shower-only friend after 3 months, occasional-bath friend after 6 months, bath-only friend after 8 months), we all followed the above instructions including soaking our feet for about 30 minutes every other day for the following two weeks, and we all three had perfect results the second time. We Highly recommend this product, but also recommend that product instructions be modified & clarified by the marketer.little item written only in the little Instruction Manual sheet included in the box, \\"Note: We recommend taking a footbath to enhance the effects BEFORE (sic) and AFTER (sic) using this product.\\"<br /><br />So we got out a large bowl, filled it with water, and had our shower-only friend soak her feet for 30 minutes, and voila! the dead & dry skin on her foot looked white & \\"loose\\", and she rubbed it with her finger and it started sloughing off. She put her feet back in the water & soaked for another hour, and when she took them out & blotted them with a towel there was peeling all over her toes and peeling & sloughing on her heels & the ball of her foot. The shower-only fried didn't soak her feet again, and after two weeks most of the dead & dry skin had come off well-enough. The other two of us soaked our feet every day (the bath-only friend) or every other day (the occasional-bath friend) for the next two weeks, and both of us ended up with every single bit of dead & dry skin removed, and had completely baby-soft feet.<br /><br />At different times all three of us have used it a second time after the initial use (shower-only friend after 3 months, occasional-bath friend after 6 months, bath-only friend after 8 months), we all followed the above instructions including soaking our feet for about 30 minutes every other day for the following two weeks, and we all three had perfect results the second time. We Highly recommend this product, but also recommend that product instructions be modified & clarified by the marketer.

  1308. Although typically a shower person, I made a point of soaking my feet for fifteen minutes or so each day. After approximately five days my feet began to peel.   1310. IT WORKS LIKE ADVERTISED. HOWEVER, A RECOMMENDATION I HAVE WOULD BE FOR YOU TO SOAK YOUR FEET NIGHTLY FOLLOWING THE USE OF THE PRODUCT. IT HELPS THE PEELING PROCESS. One benefit is that I discovered that a mysterious pain I've been having in one foot is actually because I have a wood chip or something embedded in my foot!! Apparently it went through that thick callous I had and I never even felt it until it had worked itself deeply in - I'm seeing a doctor about it this week. It's taking some time to adjust to the fact that I can actually feel things with my feet now, but I am so glad to have found this product in time for sandal season.

  1420. It baffles me that this hasn't worked for some people. I was getting impatient because the peeling didn't kick in for a full week, but when it started, holy cow. Taking a bath or at least a foot bath first is a good idea, and every day for the duration until it's all done. One thing - do NOT peel still-attached skin... if it's still connected, it's because the layer underneath isn't ready yet. This is not instantaneous; it takes a few days and works a lot better if you're patient. (Be sure to wear closed shoes, socks or tights for a while because trust me, nobody needs to see this action.). When it's over, you have brand new feet!
  1421. Initially it worked great, but now my feet are muuuuxh dryer and hard than they have ever been. I never had much of an issue before with this and now I regret having used this product.
  1422. Worked exactly as advertised! Beware of grungy looking feet for a week after actual peel begins!
  1423. This stuff is awesome!
  1424. Yes it peeled my feet until they were soft and pink. I also got a raging cellulitis (skin infection) in both feet a few days later. I had to go to the emergency room because my feet and lower legs were swollen and red and painful. The doctor explained that the peel had caused microscopic tears in the skin and as it began to peel a buttload of staph bacteria entered my feet which caused a raging infection. It is 3 weeks later and I just finished antibiotics, but my feet are still swollen and red. My doctor told me to NEVER EVER do that again. So all I can say is use at your own risk.
  1425. Works exactly as advertised. Leaves feet soft and pretty. Make sure you soak in warm to hot water before application and every day after to speed sloughing as you will start shedding dead skin. Fast.

  1433. First the best \\"HOW TO\\" IMO after using the product every few months for at least a year. THEN my original review. It's long to read but detailed ;)<br /><br />I'm a cosmetologist, so, I know about the majority of the salon peels out there and how to use them. A lot of them are extremely dangerous. BABYFOOT blows those away. Follow these steps for best results. REMEMBER TO RINSE THOROUGHLY AFTER THE TREATMENT. IF YOU FEEL BURNING WASH WITH SOAP. DO NOT ADD LOTION TO SOOTH, SOAP STOPS CHEMICAL REACTIONS OF PEELS LOTION WILL BURN DEEPER. I DO NOT THINK BABY FOOT WOULD EVER CAUSE THIS PROBLEM BUT IN CASE IT DOES KEEP THIS IN MIND.<br /><br />1. Prepare to relax! Set up a relax station before you get started. Either with a book or your favorite movie (but I don't suggest having electronics near water)<br />2. Prepare a soak using a mixture of 3 cups White Vinegar, 1 dollar store bottle of Listerine,1 cup Epsom salt put it all into the foot bath container and add a tea kettle of boiled water mix with a wooden spoon and let cool until the heat is comfortable.<br />3. Soak your feet for 30 minutes<br />4. While still using the foot bath scrub your feet over it with a prepared mixture of 1/3 cup White Vinegar, 1/3 cup Listerine, 1/4 cup Epsom salt, 1&3/4 cups white sugar. Rinse in the foot bath. Then rinse in clean clear water.<br />5. OPTIONAL use a ped egg to free the loose skin and expose what needs the magical work of baby foot WASH&RINSE FEET<br />6. Wear the booties 1 to 2 hours<br />7. RINSE WITH WATER AND PUT SOCKS ON LEAVE YOUR FEET ALONE, AND LOTION FREE FOR AT LEAST 2 DAYS<br /><br />UPDATE:<br />This works wonders. After a few treatments I got the hang of it. Below is my first time experience using BABY FOOT.<br />I have naturally dry feet (deep callouses,cracks,sandpaper feeling) so I had to wet my feet for it to work. The product requires patience. It won't work instantly it takes at least a week! I like to use two treatments spaced five to seven days apart.I was mind-blown that it actually worked. It is pricey but beauty comes with a price tag.<br /><br />Day 1<br /><br />Any one who knows me, knows that my feet are gross...But I am sick of hiding them~ my whole body is a freaking dry scale. So, in the summer I tell my flip-flops \\"join my dry cracked feet and lets make them cruddier!\\".<br /><br />Well, I've tried everything since age 11 to get luscious/bodacious feet. I've even considered harvesting the dead skin devouring fish found in some high end salons. Being a cosmetologist I have access to every pedi \\"cure\\" in the book. And you know what? They all failed! My feet were soft for minuscule moments and almost immediately dried up again! 16 years of trial after trial later here comes Baby Foot. I've never seen a method quite like this! Baby Foot claims to be a a deep exfoliating foot peel that takes 2-14 days before any results are seen. Scrolling through photos and testimonials it seems marvelously promising. Almost too good to be true actually. At first glance, I thought \\"A very overly priced version of my softening socks.\\". Yet, I can not get over the before and after photos plastered through out the site! Sometimes beauty comes from the most disgusting of things (child birth for example) lets see if these tired, over-worked mommy soles can be reborn! join me in my 2-14 day journey to newborn feet!<br /><br />Day 2<br /><br />The tops of my feet have started to be painlessly peel and what has been revealed truly does feel like baby skin! The soles are softer, but no progress has happened as for peeling/exfoliation. Lets see how day 3 goes!<br /><br />36 Hours<br /><br />The first 24 hours had my feet itchy and they slightly flaked. Now 36 hours later I took a soak in bubble-less water and dead skin just started to roll off into little beads I took some photos to show you the progress.<br /><br />After 48 Hours I did not see any changes my feet are dry with no peeling left. I'm supposed to wait 2 weeks before finalizing results but I think the process is done. I'll let you know if I have any more progress.<br /><br />After 2 weeks and lotion my feet are softer than when I was a child! I'm hooked!izing results but I think the process is done. I'll let you know if I have any more progress.<br /><br />After 2 weeks and lotion my feet are softer than when I was a child! I'm hooked!

  1491. It's been two days and I am already seeing results. Tuesday night I settled in and decided to do the peel. I had read several reviews online from a few different sites and saw that the people that were saying they were getting the best results were<br /><br />1)soaking their feet prior to application and nightly while waiting for results (usually bath people)<br />2)wearing the booties for 1.5- 2 hours<br />3) NOT putting lotion on their feet during the peeling process<br /><br />I pulled out the footbath, towels, socks, wine and laptop and was ready to go. I had taken baths as opposed to showers in the week prior waiting for the peel to arrive, so my feet were getting nightly soak time. I soaked them for an additional 25 minutes prior to wearing the booties (dry them first). Once I had the booties on I pulled a pair of socks over them (a tip from a beauty site that reviewed them) and that really helped. The liquid within the booties squished into all of the tight spots and my whole foot got coated. Plus the two times I did need to get up, I was able to walk (slowly) without the plastic booties sliding all over the place. I pulled up a movie and watched the whole thing, so I soaked for almost two hours. After I cleaned my feet and went to bed. I took a long bath Wednesday and a long bath today.<br /><br />The packet tells you that if your feet become too dry, then you can use a SMALL amount of lotion, but I think some people are misunderstanding this and thinking they are supposed to use lotion each night. You do not want to use lotion. This product is going to make your feet dry out, that is what causes the peeling. So it may be uncomfortable, but suck it up and have some dry feet for a few days! The next day (Wednesday) I noticed that the areas that needed the most 'work' were a bit more sensitive. Today (Thursday) I noticed that my feet looked noticeably worse. The heels were super dry and turning a white color. After my bath, I rubbed one heel gently and a giant, disgusting chunk of skin just fell off. I rubbed the rest of my foot (no scratching, no pulling) and my entire foot began to flake off bits of funky dead skin.<br /><br />2 DAYS!!!!<br /><br />I will update this in a few more days and give details on how long the process took for me.<br /><br />*UPDATE*<br /><br />It's been30 minutes since I wrote my review. I went to bed and quickly realized that it is necessary to wear socks to bed when using this product! So gross, but it's what I paid for. Also looking at my feet after they had totally dried out from my bath made me see exactly how much is peeling. The heels, balls of my feet and sides of my toes look like they have tiny bubble forming under them. Ewwwwww<br /><br />*Friday Night*<br /><br />This is disgusting- in a good way? I absentmindedly reached down to scratch the bottom of my foot (did notice a slight itch today) and a huge panel of skin as long as my hand and half as wide came off like it was nothing. The terrible calluses on my heels and balls of my feet are peeling in gross thick layers. The ball under one big toe is not quite at the peeling point, but the rest of the area has peeled so much that the variance in thickness is visible to the naked eye. Plus today I started to see all the areas of my foot that I thought were 'ok' start showing how gross they were without me knowing it!<br /><br />The soaking is a must. The more you soak, the more peeling occurs. I will suggest that you refrain from peeling when you get in the tub if you are taking baths. In fact don't touch your feet at all when you get in the tub. Either wait until the end of your bath and then sit outside of your bath and scrub your feet or shower and use a foot bath for foot soaking and scrubbing. There's a lot of skin coming off and you don't want it floating in your tub!<br /><br />**April 18 Update**<br /><br />After three weeks I thought that it must be finished. Most of the calluses were gone with the exception of a bit on the side of my big toes and the center line of the ball of my feet (those of you that frequently wear higher heels will know exactly what that line is) and I was VERY happy with that. It was by far better than any pedicure result I have ever had. I decided that my heel addiction had left my feet in pretty bad shape and that I would do a second packet in a month to get that last bit taken care of. The thing is...I still am seeing slight peeling.<br /><br />It's been over a month and while I don't see peeling every day, and it usually is not much, I am still slowly losing that area by my big toes. I have made sure to use baths as opposed to showers at least three times a week and every time I am able to scratch a bit more off. I lost a huge chunk off the last of the callus on my right big toe today and (sorry, this is so very, very gross!!!) I had to clean out my nails 5 times just from scratching my feet after my bath! I don't know if anyone else has had these type of long results or if it is just because I left the pack on longer and continued to soak weekly, but this is pretty phenomenal. I will be buying this again in the future.ide of my big toes and the center line of the ball of my feet (those of you that frequently wear higher heels will know exactly what that line is) and I was VERY happy with that. It was by far better than any pedicure result I have ever had. I decided that my heel addiction had left my feet in pretty bad shape and that I would do a second packet in a month to get that last bit taken care of. The thing is...I still am seeing slight peeling.<br /><br />It's been over a month and while I don't see peeling every day, and it usually is not much, I am still slowly losing that area by my big toes. I have made sure to use baths as opposed to showers at least three times a week and every time I am able to scratch a bit more off. I lost a huge chunk off the last of the callus on my right big toe today and (sorry, this is so very, very gross!!!) I had to clean out my nails 5 times just from scratching my feet after my bath! I don't know if anyone else has had these type of long results or if it is just because I left the pack on longer and continued to soak weekly, but this is pretty phenomenal. I will be buying this again in the future.
  1492. this product is amazing. takes several days and then the dead skin rolls off. about every 3 months is a lovely treat for tired feet.
  1493. I don't know how this stuff does what it does, and maybe I don't want to know, but it has changed my life! My feet belonged in a horror movie. I have always loved going barefoot, but that's kind of like sun exposure - you might look good in a tan, but you'll pay the price eventually. When I first used it, there seemed to be nothing going on. You follow all of the directions and . . . nothing! But about the time you forget you ever tried it, maybe 4 or 5 days later, suddenly you're growing a new pair of feet. The old feet just peel away and, yes, it's baby foot time! I truly think that my feet haven't looked or felt like this since I was a baby. From other reviews I've read, some other products may call themselves Baby Foot but don't work. I don't know. This worked like a miracle!
  1494. I didn't know what to expect but it took 5 days for my feet start peeling and they kept peeling for close to a week later. Let me tell you, my feet have never felt so soft!!!!
  1495. I followed all directions and kept these on for an hour, but only peeled slightly on the sides and tops of my feet. The bottoms did not peel at all. I don't know if I should have kept them on longer as I have very thick callouses. I'd love to try it again, but don't want to pay $25 again for less than desirable results.
  1496. The product worked...it took 4 days for the foot skin to start peeling. I am just let it peel away naturally. Hopefully the end result will be baby feet in a 56 yr old lady<br /><br />Update<br /><br />..Impossible to leave nature takes its course...foot still peeling after 3 days and it's just fun to help the process and peel away chucks of skin. Be prepare to pass the vacuum a lot.<br />The heels are more stubborn than the rest I think I will need another treatment after a month or so.
  1497. Amazing! This product totally works and my feet feel (and look) fantastic! I will definitely purchase this again!
  1498. .<br /><br />Five star product!<br /><br />I was a little afraid, after reading some of the reviews, when I received my order of Baby Foot. But not to worry! I will order this again. And again. And again.<br /><br />SIZE: I also received a package with Japanese writing on it. More importantly, at the top corner, it indicated it was a \\"size M.\\" I wear a size 10 shoe (well, what can I say, I have a big heart, you know). One reviewer said she wears a size 9 and had trouble getting her foot into the bootie. NO WORRIES HERE! The booties are big enough for an American Size 10 Woman's foot, though you still have to be careful putting them on due to the amount of gel inside.<br /><br />PROCESS: I decided, also based on other reviews, to a) soak my feet for 15 minutes (which turned into 20 because I was catching up on phone calls) before putting on the booties and b) to soak in the booties for 2 hours, rather than the 30 minutes the box recommends. It's true that you should be very careful walking in the booties, since the insides are slippery and could make you lose your balance. Buyer beware! and use caution! I put some acrylic socks on over the booties, and also wore my rubber-soled sheepskin bedroom slippers over that, and this stabilized things somewhat. I still needed to step carefully, and so here I am, sitting for the next long stretch until I'm done \\"soaking.\\" I think anyone using this product should plan to sit still with a good book or a laptop or TV while \\"soaking.\\"<br /><br />After having the booties on for almost an hour, I felt a slight warmth or tingling in the outer part of my foot. Nothing to be concerned about.<br /><br />I did read the review that said the woman's box had gel with much less acid listed in the ingredients. Mine seems to be the original recipe, with glycolic acid listed as the fourth ingredient (after water, alcohol and isopropyl alcohol). Lactic acid is fifth, salicylic acid is further down the line, followed by citric acid and malic acid. Following those are the herbal ingredients that seem more soothing. The box I received says nothing about being \\"lavender scented,\\" nor did I detect any scent remotely like lavender.<br /><br />MY EXPERIENCE WITH THIS PRODUCT: I never had much problem with callouses on my feet until I reached a certain...ahem...age. Perhaps because my skin is not as moist as it used to be, or perhaps because I have fewer hormones, I have a greater problem keeping the callouses on my heels under control. My weapon of choice has been one of those paddles you buy at the drug store with the pumice-like surface in two levels of roughness. I used the higher level on my heels before showering, and always get a bunch of callous shavings off. Then I put cream on my feet. I have one frustrating area I can never get to sufficiently: an oval area in the center of the ball of my foot. The \\"pumice paddle\\" tool doesn't get to that area. I've also used a Dremel with a smoothing head, and, while that works, it doesn't get all of it. I've tried cutting it, with some success. And I've had the podiatrist remove it, which works best. I'm hoping this treatment takes away all my callouses, completely.<br /><br />UPDATE, 2 hours later: I have now removed the booties and washed the gel off. I already have quite a bit of softenED callous rolling off of my heels when I rubbed with the towel. I'm pretty sure this much would not have come off after a two-hour bath soak, though the longest I ever soak for is about an hour. I just haven't seen it this soft after just a water soak, so I'm sure the gel is already working. It's not a peeling or flaking at this point, just a good amount that rolled off with the toweling. I'm here with comfy clean socks on, just waiting for the miracle to happen.<br /><br />UPDATE, Day 2: no peeling yet or shedding. About 2 hours after I wrote the last update, I realized why some reviewers are saying the product made their feet \\"worse.\\" My feet, especially at the problem callous areas on my heels and outer edges of the sole, started looking and feeling really rough. Yesterday and today, the skin feels sort of stiff, and tingly almost to the point of sun-burny, probably because I left the stuff on for 2 hours. But they don't really hurt, just a strong tingly feel. I soaked my feet for about 10 to 15 minutes last night, and towelled them off, rubbing the skin well. Not much came off. The heels and sides still look rough today. Socks are necessary today, for sure. Waiting patiently for the peeling to begin.<br /><br />UPDATE, Day 4: The tops of my feet are starting to peel. Nothing on the rest of the foot, meaning the bottoms where the callouses are, where it's really needed. I have soaked my feet for 20 minutes twice since using the product, most recently last night. I have not used lotion, for fear it would interfere with the process. I'm beginning to wonder if I will be one of those on whom this product does not work very well. Wonder what will happen tomorrow.<br /><br />UPDATE, Day 6: My feet started peeling seriously last night, the evening of my 5th day. A couple hours later, they were absolutely shedding. Huge strips of skin started sloughing off, on the tops of my feet and on the bottoms. I did read the review suggesting you shouldn't pull the skin off, but I could not resist. I sort of wanted to control where all this skin was going to land. I did not pull it off if it did not come easily.<br /><br />Today, Day 6, the peeling and sloughing continues, though not as wildly. My heels and that pesky oval callous on each of my insteps are still there, though better, and are rough, not \\"baby-soft,\\" and I am hoping I can look forward to more peeling in those sections. Otherwise, I will do another session in a month or so - after whatever the recommended waiting time is.<br /><br />UPDATE, Day 7: Late yesterday, a few hours after writing the Day 6 update, I noticed the callouses on my heels were sort of crumbling, but not peeling off. I decided to soak my feet again, and this time ran hot water into the tub. It was warm enough that I had to put my feet in and out to get used to it. After putting my feet in, I did cool the temp down by running some cold water, but still let the water be warm. I soaked for 20 minutes, then toweled them, rubbing firmly with the towel. The remaining callouses just rolled away, and I am left with beautiful feet.<br /><br />That being said, I am now noticing that some places on the heels still feel \\"thick\\", though they look great. Also, there is still a \\"thicker\\" area on the balls of my feet, in the center where that tough-to-reach callous was. I think I had a lot more callous build-up than I ever realized. I am definitely going to order another kit and do this again in a few weeks.<br /><br />I have to give this product all 5 stars. (I wish I could give it 6 stars.) It's fantastic, and works just as promised. I'm wondering if they will come out with a similar product for hands, though, yes, I know you would have to hide away for a couple weeks or wear gloves! It just would be great to get the thin callouses that form on one's hands as life goes on. The thin, thicker skin that the manicurist does not or cannot remove.<br /><br />I will update my review again after I try another session, or if there is more to report with this session in the next week.ly at the problem callous areas on my heels and outer edges of the sole, started looking and feeling really rough. Yesterday and today, the skin feels sort of stiff, and tingly almost to the point of sun-burny, probably because I left the stuff on for 2 hours. But they don't really hurt, just a strong tingly feel. I soaked my feet for about 10 to 15 minutes last night, and towelled them off, rubbing the skin well. Not much came off. The heels and sides still look rough today. Socks are necessary today, for sure. Waiting patiently for the peeling to begin.<br /><br />UPDATE, Day 4: The tops of my feet are starting to peel. Nothing on the rest of the foot, meaning the bottoms where the callouses are, where it's really needed. I have soaked my feet for 20 minutes twice since using the product, most recently last night. I have not used lotion, for fear it would interfere with the process. I'm beginning to wonder if I will be one of those on whom this product does not work very well. Wonder what will happen tomorrow.<br /><br />UPDATE, Day 6: My feet started peeling seriously last night, the evening of my 5th day. A couple hours later, they were absolutely shedding. Huge strips of skin started sloughing off, on the tops of my feet and on the bottoms. I did read the review suggesting you shouldn't pull the skin off, but I could not resist. I sort of wanted to control where all this skin was going to land. I did not pull it off if it did not come easily.<br /><br />Today, Day 6, the peeling and sloughing continues, though not as wildly. My heels and that pesky oval callous on each of my insteps are still there, though better, and are rough, not \\"baby-soft,\\" and I am hoping I can look forward to more peeling in those sections. Otherwise, I will do another session in a month or so - after whatever the recommended waiting time is.<br /><br />UPDATE, Day 7: Late yesterday, a few hours after writing the Day 6 update, I noticed the callouses on my heels were sortof crumbling, but not peeling off. I decided to soak my feet again, and this time ran hot water into the tub. It was warm enough that I had to put my feet in and out to get used to it. After putting my feet in, I did cool the temp down by running some cold water, but still let the water be warm. I soaked for 20 minutes, then toweled them, rubbing firmly with the towel. The remaining callouses just rolled away, and I am left with beautiful feet.<br /><br />That being said, I am now noticing that some places on the heels still feel \\"thick\\", though they look great. Also, there is still a \\"thicker\\" area on the balls of my feet, in the center where that tough-to-reach callous was. I think I had a lot more callous build-up than I ever realized. I am definitely going to order another kit and do this again in a few weeks.<br /><br />I have to give this product all 5 stars. (I wish I could give it 6 stars.) It's fantastic, and works just as promised. I'm wondering if they will come out with a similar product for hands, though, yes, I know you would have to hide away for a couple weeks or wear gloves! It just would be great to get the thin callouses that form on one's hands as life goes on. The thin, thicker skin that the manicurist does not or cannot remove.<br /><br />I will update my review again after I try another session, or if there is more to report with this session in the next week.

It would be embarrassing to go out in public with feet looking all peeling and such. Also, I hear it works on athlete's foot fungus. That doesn't surprise me at all as it peels off the skin impressively and it would be a great adjunct to the cream medication for athlete's foot, in my opinion--well quite frankly I had good results with that on one foot. I would also comment that it doesn't hurt at all. I followed the instructions on the package but in addition, I put my winter slippers on over the booties you wear. I felt more stable wearing my slippers with them walking around the house than just the plastic booties. I am really quite surprised this isn't marketed better here in the US. It would virtually replace a pedicure, save the nail painting. I have never had a pedicure that has been better than the results I get with BabyFoot.<br /><br />Now for the tip*<br /><br />*TIP: In between uses, as in every other day, I use shampoo or conditioner on the bottom of my feet and use Gillette Fusion razor to shave the bottoms of my feet. I have not cut myself once. It keeps the feet very soft. For my feet, I spend about 3 minutes shaving and reshaving each foot. I have used other brands of razors and have found that the Gillette Fusion razor is the best. After about a month, I switch razor heads. It's wonderful. Sometimes I use just conditioner on my feet instead of shampoo to shave. Now, with that said, I really don't have to start shaving my feet until a week or so after my foot has exfoliated because Baby Foot is so good. I bought two packages of Baby Foot this time and I can probably shave my feet for about 5 months or so before needing baby foot again. This is great for pretty summer feet. Thank me after you try it!ummer feet. Thank me after you try it!

  1514. This product, baby foot, actually does what it is intended to do. However, I gave it a low rating because it was a very messy process. I soaked my feet on October 3, 2014 and applied the booties for an hour. I rinsed my feet after removing from the booties. The soles of my feet began to peel 4 days later on October 7, 2014. The shedding or peeling got worse as days went by. Large pieces of skin was hanging from my feet and it was really gross. I would find skin in my sheets and on the rug. The peeling went from the soles of my feet to the toes and then up my ankles. During this time I had to try to hide it by wearing closed up shoes which I do not have many of. My skin finally stopped peeling on October 21, 2014. You can help to peel some of the skin but you have to be careful you don't pull and tear living skin. I just felt it was a messy, awful process. But my feet are baby soft. I would not use this product again or recommend it to anyone based on my experience. However, if your feet are really bad and a pedicure does not help, this product is worth the stress and torment. It really works.

  1532.   1533. I loved this. There is a commitment, however. As the skin starts to peel away, it is a little gross and don't expect miracles on the first day. It'll look like you wore socks while laying out for 2 weeks in Bermuda!<br />But in other words, product works great, it peeled the most whenever I would get out of the shower and walked around while my feet were still moist to really loosen up the skin. It finally stopped peeling after about 8 days.<br />This is a product I definitely buy every year, maybe twice, to really get these crusty feet I gawt back in tip top shape for brighter days!

  1571. Some people have those heavily calloused feet, the heels are in particularly bad shape. My heels are not in the worst shape but they are also not in the best. That said, I kept the boots on for an hour, (after getting out of a hot 20 minute shower) washed and moisturized my feet, put socks on and waited. It did take about 6 days for me to see anything, but I know that it takes different amounts of time for everyone. My feet then started to peel and it was kind of interesting. Looked like I had put Elmers glue on my feet and was then able to peel it. It was unique, and a novel idea, but my heels are just as rough as before, my feet don't look particularly better and frankly I'm more impressed when I find the right foot cream. The directions say that you may need to use it again in order to get the best results. It also says to never use the same boots twice.   1577. I used this product to remove some calluses that weren't that bad, based on other reviewers results. I wanted my heels and calluses on my big toe and the edge of the balls of my feet to be softer. I followed the directions to the letter. My results? After a couple weeks, what peeled most was the tender uncallused area on the underside of my foot, while the callused part pretty much remained the same. I would say that it did NOT perform as described. I have actually had better results with Pretty Feet, which you apply only to the areas that are callused. Baby Foot has you soak the entire foot in their solution inside a plastic bootie. Also, be warned: don't try to walk around with the booties on. They're very slippery inside. All in all, I think Pretty Feet is a much more effective product, and way less expensive.

About 7 days after I had originally applied the baby foot, the peeling stopped and left me with completely smooth skin on my feet! I have pedicures pretty regularly and they have never been able to take care of the callouses and cracked heels but baby foot did it in a matter of a week. I HIGHLY recommend!!!

I figured they would be all loose and floppy. there is about half an inch to an inch of room left around my toes. again, my feet are wide, and flat. there is enough room for these to slip on with ease. out of the 6 pieces of tape it came with, I only used one on each foot. the way I folded it over and taped it seems secure by its self. however, putting a pare of socks on is probably a good idea. before I put the socks on the plastic fit loosely and didn't seem like all the gel stuff was surrounding my foot. when I put the sock on it pushed the foot juice around my whole foot which in the end feels a lot better to me.<br />I will post again later to let you know the end result. so far, I am pleased. minus the lavender and the style of box , I got what it said I would get, and so far it's feeling pretty darn good on my feet. hope this was of help to you.<br /><br />3/2/14<br />update one: It has now been a day since I used this product. it's too soon for my feet to start peeling, but there is a noticeable difference with how my feet feel. they feel nice and soft... the calluses on my feet even feel smooth. I hope this stuff works like it says it does...so far i'm pretty impressed with the overall soft feeling.<br /><br />3/4/14<br />update two: my toes are starting to peel. this is good news for me because I am one of those sick people that likes to peel off dead skin after sunburns, HA! my heels are starting to look like they are going to peel soon.<br /><br />3/5/14<br />update 3: I cannot begin to tell you how awesomely disgusting my feet look right now. i'm shedding like crazy. my 3 year old keeps telling me I have owies on my feet and persistently asks if he can pick it. this product is definitely doing what it says it does. I think I will wait a few more days before I do another update now. still pretty thrilled with this product.<br /><br />3/6/14<br />final update: 95% of all dead skin has been peeled off my feet. there are some patches that I don't want to force off. I just want you all to know that this feels like my feet are feeling textures for the first time... i could feel things with my feet before, but in comparison, everything felt dull prior to using babyfoot. I don't know how to explain it well. i guess it's just something you need to experience in order to fully understand what i'm talking about?<br /> Thanks for reading, and happy peeling.of those sick people that likes to peel off dead skin after sunburns, HA! my heels are starting to look like they are going to peel soon.<br /><br />3/5/14<br />update 3: I cannot begin to tell you how awesomely disgusting my feet look right now. i'm shedding like crazy. my 3 year old keeps telling me I have owies on my feet and persistently asks if he can pick it. this product is definitely doing what it says it does.   1653. Based on the reviews, which I read extensively before and after purchasing this item - I was really excited to try this out. The package arrived and was exactly what is pictured in the picture. I waited a few days and then took my chance. I put my two year old to bed and got started. I soaked my feet beforehand as many reviewers suggested. The booties were plenty big for my (female, size 9 in US) feet. The gel was cold and it felt a bit icky but I grew used to it in time. As other reviewers said, it is not pleasant or easy to try and walk anywhere in these, so have everything ready at hand before beginning. The smell was not unpleasant. It reminded me of something from my childhood but I still cannot place that smell! It nags at me... My package said to leave the booties on for one hour. My feet are very dry though with large calluses on my big toes from having bunions. My heels were cracked and dry. So, I left the booties on for an hour and a half. After I was done I washed my feet under running water with soap, and went to bed. I never felt any tingling or discomfort. In the coming day and a half my feet got incredibly dry. I did not moisturize them because the instructions said not to.Around 3 days later I began to notice that my feet felt strange when walking on carpet - it's hard to describe but it felt like one layer of skin wasn't my skin anymore. Like there was a pocket between my skin and my foot. At that point I was sure it was going to work like it said it would! When my foot did begin to peel it was a real let down. It did not peel on the top of my feet at all, despite what some reviews have stated. And unlike the pictures I've seen online, my dry skin seemed to flake off in miniscule pieces. I could not peel them off in one piece. I had to rub my feet to get them to come off. And sadly, there was not baby soft skin underneath. The calluses on my toes and the dry cracked skin on my heels were not affected in the slightest. I was disappointed, to say the least. I have had much more dramatic results with a softening foot bath followed by a callus razor and pumice stone.least. I have had much more dramatic results with a softening foot bath followed by a callus razor and pumice stone.

  1737. This may have been a fluke but the booties sent supposedly contain lactic and glycolic acid did not work as claimed. One should have peeling with these two acids . It did not happen. I asked for a refund or a replacement through Amazon. Platinum's representative Justine sent me an email that was rude. I can understand one bad set of booties in the thousands manufactured and I was willing to try it again. However after the email from Justine at Platinum I instead voiced my concern to Amazon. I wanted Amazon to know vendors like Platinum have no place on their site.
  1738. Despite getting monthly pedicures, the soles of my feet constantly produce mega-thick hard, dark, dry heels and skin that my pedicurist cannot get rid of. I've tried many products like hot wax, Heel-tastic, the Clarisonic pedicure system, Footlogic ... you name it -- which have delivered mediocre and temporary results. Now, thank goodness for Baby Foot! This product is MAGIC and miraculously restores your soles to baby-like softness, just as the name implies. Sit in the booties for one hour (watch TV or play on the computer), rinse well, then wait .... that's all you have to do. For me, on day 5, all of a sudden the skin of my soles started peeling off (like a suntan peel) all by itself, no need to rub or pumice, with no pain or irritated feeling. The peeling-off period lasted about another 5 days for me after which the soles of my feet were transformed into baby soft soles --- I don't remember a time when my soles looked so fresh, clean, pink and were so soft. It's now 8 weeks later, and my soles look as great as they did right after using Baby Foot. If this product cost 5 times more, I'd still buy and recommend it.
  1739. Baby Foot is an interesting product -- you put your feet into gel-filled plastic baggies shaped like little boots and tape them closed. Put a pair of socks over the top to keep everything where it belongs. An hour or so later, rinse the goop off your feet. And stand by. Within four or five days, patches of skin will start peeling off of your feet. If you want, you can spend countless hours picking off dead skin, pulling it off in inch-wide strips. Or you can just scrub it off with a washcloth or exfoliant scrub. About a week later -- voila! Baby Feet!<br /><br />During the one-week sloughing period, you feet aren't going to look so good. They may look like you have a nasty case of eczema or some bad infection. Your feet will be scaly and flaky and not so pretty. But bear with it -- they will look great in the end! Another word of caution -- best not to try walking around much with the booties on. The gel-filled plastic boot is like a little slippery slide under your feet and it is hard to get traction.<br /><br />Some people complained that this doesn't do much. I soaked my feet for about ten minutes before I used it and it worked exactly as advertised. I will definitely use this again!
  1740. Bought two - for me and Hubs. Followed directions carefully but I had no results at all. Hubs goes into a sauna and a steam room every day and he had very slight peeling after a week. I was very disappointed but have since bought the Emjoi Micro-pedi Callus Remover (also from Amazon) and my feet and heels couldn't be softer. Happy the Baby Feet worked for others but thumbs down for me.
  1741. It works like a charm.....shedded like a snake and underneath was soft skin. I went for my regular pedicure and the ladies could not believe the results I got.....they had never heard of this treatment......will for sure do Baby Feet again.
  1742. I've had bad dry, callused, cracking heels for 10-20 years now. Whether due to walking miles each day on NYC streets, wearing sandals all summer, or the dryness of winter, my heels were bad year round. Maybe once or twice a year the cracks would be deep enough to bleed. I'm sure many of you know exactly what this is like. I've tried SO many things, beginning with basic filing (like a giant nail file), the Ped Egg, full foot gel \\"socks\\" to wear at night \\"impregnated\\" with whatever, heel-only gel booties (to be worn at night), various foot creams with big promises also worn at night with spa socks and also in the day, Heel-Tastic (a waxy great smelling foot stick that did nothing for ME after two months of daily use except for make the dirt of summer New York streets stick to my heels when I used it with sandals creating black greasy grimy heels!), Amlactin foot cream, and both a Pedi-Spin and a dremel grinder. Ugh! All labor intensive and simply not effective. The grinders would of course grind off the callus, but somehow my foot skin would then actually be MORE susceptible to splitting :(<br /><br />In August this summer I read about Baby Foot and was both skeptical yet cautiously optimistic, and ordered a pack. I took the \\"before picture\\" (which you can see in the customer submitted pictures at the top of the page) while excitedly awaiting my delivery. The after picture that you can also see, speaks for itself. However, I will note that the after picture represents 4 treatments - approximately one (3 hour) treatment every 2-3 weeks. At that point my calluses were probably one treatment away from completely gone. Don't expect to have 100% callus removal in just one session.<br /><br />My method: Fresh from a long hot shower, I immediately put on the booties while my skin is still hydrated and soft(ish). Wear them around the house for 3-4 hours. Rinse off with water. Don't bother with slathering on lotion - I experimented with Amlactin foot lotion on one foot and left the other alone, and they both peeled at about day 5-7 at exactly the same rate and amount, the cream did bubkus. Which is good news actually, the less effort and fuss for me the better. At about 5-7 days the layers of dead callus start peeling (I use a pumice stone in the shower to help it off so I wouldn't track it all over my apartment, and because it's just so gratifying to watch it all slough off - the box says not to force it off, but go ahead and help it off, just be gentle. I think your nerve endings know if you're pulling off skin that's not ready!). I discovered calluses peeling from places I didn't even realize were callused (the tips of my toes for example), which is all very satisfying.<br /><br />I am ordering a \\"teaser\\" pack each for everyone in my family this Christmas - once they try it, I know they'll be hooked like me. To finally have smooth, soft heels after all these years (and all the other failed products) is just plain wonderful.d left the other alone, and they both peeled at about day 5-7 at exactly the same rate and amount, the cream did bubkus. To finally have smooth, soft heels after all these years (and all the other failed products) is just plain wonderful.

Instead my feet dried out a lot and peeled of in itty bitty annoying pieces. It took about a week to start peeling and another week or so do stop.
  1744. Okay, I tried baby foot about 6 times in the summer/fall 2014 and then two more in the winter.... and I can honestly say that I hate myself for spending so much money on this product. It works to peel the skin but if you have really bad callus problems (as I did) you will regret ever wasting your money on this. I will tell you right now that you will be looking at a good 12 purchases to get your feet even remotely close to a smooth as a 'baby foot' foot.<br /><br />Fast forward to last month when I was strapped for cash but REALLY needed my foot-peel fix... so I ordered one box and made it last for two uses by using a single bootie for each treatment. I had to sit twice as long and as I sat I started to think. Thinking lead to questioning myself.<br /><br />I started to question WHY I was continuing to waste my time and money on this product. I mean, at this point I was 8 treatments in and I was STILL just as embarrassed by my feet as I was before I started. They were STILL dry and callused- admittedly it wasn't as bad as before I used it but it sure as hell wasn't a baby smooth foot.<br /><br />After sulking and thinking about how much money I wasted using their product the past 8 times I decided to search for alternatives.<br /><br />I then found this thing from 'Etude House' called bebe foot mask pack. It was roughly 7 dollars total for one treatment with free shipping and I was skeptical but figured what harm could trying it do. The worst case scenario would be that it does nothing and I blow 7 bucks, best case it works as well as baby foot and I can get three treatments of theirs for the price of ONE box of baby foot.<br /><br />So, I tried it.<br /><br />I purchased from another popular auction-based site since it was 3 dollars cheaper there with free shipping) and surprise, surprise it ended up working BETTER in ONE USE than baby foot did in five+ uses... and it is 1/3rd the price. Go figure.<br /><br />Morale of the story? This stuff is way too overpriced and overall not worth it.<br /><br />Now that I've found something that works better for about $7 a treatment I won't be back.<br /><br />Thanks anyway, baby foot. =)<br /><br />-- For Those Who Want To Get The Most From Baby Foot Treatments --<br /><br />If you DO decide to purchase this I will suggest SOAK YOUR FEET before using it. It really helps.<br /><br />I like to put a pair of tight-fitting socks over the plastic bootie to help it stay snug to my skin as much as possible.<br /><br />Also expect to soak your feet daily for a good 15 minutes a day after the treatment as well as moisturize daily (or nightly) to help the peeling process along. Note that it will take about a full week of this regime to make a difference.<br /><br />Also, if you are the type to pick at a sunburn or flakey skin then you WILL be tempted to peel your feet. You may think you can resist but when you start having 'peeling lizard syndrome' on your tootsies you'll break and start to pick. Best thing is to just go and soak your feet and gently rub them to remove the shedding skin that is ready to peel off. ( If you FORCIBLY peel the skin you run the risk of peeling up skin that was not ready to be peeled... Seriously take this warning, you WILL rip up healthy tissue if you force it to peel and it isn't ready. I did it to myself. It starts peeling just fine but then all of a sudden you're all,&#34;OW, WTF JUST HAPPENED? WHY DO I HURT? HOLY CRAP IS THAT BLOOD?!)<br /><br />One last thing, remain seated. The boots are as slippery as standing on greased up glass.<br /><br />But my title still stands as my main point. Baby Foot is a rip off, plain and simple. Save your money.d overall not worth it.<br /><br />Now that I've found something that works better for about $7 a treatment I won't be back.<br /><br />Thanks anyway, baby foot. =)<br /><br />-- For Those Who Want To Get The Most From Baby Foot Treatments --<br /><br />If you DO decide to purchase this I will suggest SOAK YOUR FEET before using it. It really helps.<br /><br />I like to put a pair of tight-fitting socks over the plastic bootie to help it stay snug to my skin as much as possible.<br /><br />Also expect to soak your feet daily for a good 15 minutes a day after the treatment as well as moisturize daily (or nightly) to help the peeling process along.   1747. This product is miraculous! My mom and I both had excellent results Just pre-soak your feet for a half hour or so before application, and leave hte booties (covered with warm socks) on longer than the recommended one hour--even two hours is fine. In about three days, your feet will begin to peel--even in unexpected areas like the arches and up the sides. Soak your feet daily for that first week after application, then help the painless peel along if you like--as you would with a sunburn (for those of us who remember sunburns!) . You will end up with the smoothest, softest feet you can imagine! Just like a baby's!

  1775.   1785. I have purchased this item twice now, and I will continue to buy it when I need to use it again. It works exactly as it says and does not disappoint. My feet aren't particularly gross, but they do get a bit tough and discolored from wearing dyed moccasins most months out of the year. I leave the booties on for an hour and a half to two hours, then walk very slowly to the bathroom to wash the gel off. You have to schedule when you wear these carefully...don't expect to cook dinner or do things around the house when you have them on. I find them extremely slippery and difficult to walk in. It's not really a problem for me because it's so friggin' worth it. Even though it's lavender scented, I detect a citrus-like scent. I'm guessing that's from the citrus peel stuff in the gel. I don't feel the need to soak my feet before use like some people suggest. I do, however, try to soak them or take more showers 3-7 days after when the peeling action really ramps up. It's not necessary, but I find it helps speed up the process which is nice because taking the dead skin off my feet is all I can think about after I use this product and until the nice soft feet underneath are revealed. Everyone in my family uses this product a few times a year, and that includes people with troll feet and people with normal feet that might not really need the product. Anybody on here that says they have used this with no results must have some superhuman immunity or foot skin of steel...or they don't read the directions and review it before it takes effect. I have recommended it to several people that are interested in self care and beauty and also people that just like awesome gross stuff.

  1799. Excellent product however I had to research how to get the best results from this product. There are directions but if you follow just that you won't be the best results. You should soak your feet for about 10 - 15 minutes before using this product or after taking a bath. If you take a bath everyday you'll be fine after the application of the product, but if showering is your things then I would suggest soaking your feet 10 -15 minutes every day or every other day before getting in the showering. If you don't do this the product will take weeks before it starts to peel and will continue peels for even longer. Soaking your feet seems to help quicken the process you can have smooth, soft feet even sooner.
